analyzed: sūtraprasthānam
translated: The Sūtra Method.

analyzed: anuvyākhyānam
translated: The Sutra-prasthana (the source of the Vedanta philosophy).🔽The Anuvakhyana (the commentary on the Vedanta philosophy).

analyzed: nārāyaṇam nikhila pūrṇa guṇa eka deham nirdoṣam āpyatamam api akhilaiḥ su vākyaiḥ
translated: Narayana, whose body is the only one with all perfect qualities, faultless, attainable by all good words,

original: asyodbhavādidamaśeṣaviśeṣato 'pi vandyaṃ sadā priyatamaṃ mama sannamāmi // / / //🔽tameva śāstraprabhavaṃ praṇamya jagadgurūṇāṃ gurumañjasaiva /
analyzed: asya udbhavāt idam aśeṣa viśeṣataḥ vandyam sadā priyatamam mama sat namāmi  tam eva śāstra prabhavam praṇamya jagadgurūṇām gurum añjasā eva
translated: I bow to that which is always to be worshipped, even more than all this, my most beloved, I bow to it.

original: viśeṣato me paramākhyavidyāvyākhyāṃ karomyanvapi cāhameva // / / //🔽prādurbhūto harirvyāso viriñcabhavapūrvakaiḥ /
analyzed: viśeṣataḥ me parama ākhya vidyā vyākhyām karomi anu api ca aham eva  prādurbhūtaḥ hariḥ vyāsaḥ viriñca bhava pūrvakaiḥ
translated: Having bowed to that very one, the source of the scriptures, the guru of the gurus of the world, I myself will explain the supreme knowledge, even as it is.

original: arthitaḥ paravidyākhyaṃ cakre śāstramanuttamam // / / //🔽gururgurūṇāṃ prabhavaḥ śāstrāṇāṃ bādarāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: arthitaḥ paravidyā ākhyam cakre śāstram anuttamam  guruḥ gurūṇām prabhavaḥ śāstrāṇām bādarāyaṇaḥ
translated: Hari manifested as Vyasa, requested by Brahma, Shiva, and others, composed the excellent scripture called Para-vidya.

original: yatastaduditaṃ mānamajādibhyastadarthataḥ // / / //🔽vaktṛśrotṛprasaktīnāṃ yadāptiranukūlatā /🔽āptavākyatayā tena śrutimūlatayā tathā // / / //
analyzed: yatas tat uditam mānam aja ādibhyaḥ tad arthataḥ  vaktṛ śrotṛ prasaktīnām yadā āptiḥ anukūla tā  āpta vākya tayā tena śruti mūla tayā tathā
translated: Badarayana is the guru of the gurus and the source of the scriptures, from whom the meaning of the Vedas and other scriptures has arisen.

analyzed: yukti mūla tayā ca eva prāmāṇyam trividham mahat
translated: The three great authorities of the Brahmasutras are: the authoritativeness of the words of a reliable person, the authoritativeness based on the Vedas, and the authoritativeness based on reasoning.

analyzed: dṛśyate brahmasūtrāṇām ekadhā anyatra sarvaśas
translated: These three are seen in the Brahmasutras in one place, and everywhere else.

analyzed: atas nā etādṛśam kiñcid pramāṇatamam iṣyate
translated: Therefore, nothing like this is considered the best means of knowledge.

analyzed: svayam kṛtā api tad vayākhyā kriyate spaṣṭa tā arthataḥ
translated: Even though composed by oneself, that commentary is written for the sake of clear meaning.

analyzed: tatra tārātha mūla tvam sarvaśas śastrasya ca iṣyate
translated: There, the state of being the root of Tara is considered for all weapons.

analyzed: sarvatra anugata tvena pṛthak oṅkriyate khilaiḥ
translated: Being present everywhere, it is mentioned separately by all.

analyzed: ota tva vācī hi oṅkāraḥ vaktī asau tad guṇa uta tām
translated: For the syllable Om denotes weaving, and it expresses the weaving of that quality.

analyzed: saḥ eva brahma śabda arthaḥ nārāyaṇa pada uditaḥ
translated: That itself is the meaning of the word Brahman, expressed by the word Narayana.

original: sa eva bhargaśabdārtho vyāhṛtīnāṃ ca bhūmataḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva bharga śabda arthaḥ vyāhṛtīnām ca bhūmataḥ
translated: That itself is the meaning of the word Bharga, and of the Vyahrtis, from the point of view of existence.

analyzed: bhāvanāt ca eva su tvāt ca saḥ yam puruṣaḥ iti api
translated: And from the point of view of contemplation and good fortune, he is also called Purusha.

analyzed: saḥ eva sarva veda arthaḥ jijñāsyaḥ yam vidhīyate
translated: That itself is the meaning of all the Vedas, and he is enjoined to be inquired into.

original: jñānī priyatamo 'to me taṃ vidvāneva cāmṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jñānī me tam vidvān eva ca amṛtaḥ
translated: The knower is most dear to me, and only he who knows him is immortal.

original: vṛṇute yaṃ tena labhya ityādyuktibalena hi /
analyzed: vṛṇute yam tena labhyaḥ ityādi ukti balena hi
translated: For by the power of statements such as he who is chosen by him is attained by him,

analyzed: jijñāsā uttha jñāna jāt tad prasādāt eva mucyate
translated: one is liberated only by the grace of him, from the knowledge arising from inquiry.

original: dravyaṃ karma ca kālaśca svabhāvo jīva eva ca /
analyzed: dravyam karma ca kālaḥ ca svabhāvaḥ jīvaḥ eva ca
translated: Substance, action, time, nature, and the individual soul itself -

analyzed: yad anugrahataḥ santi na santi yad upekṣayā
translated: by whose favor they exist, and by whose neglect they do not exist.

original: narte tvat kriyate kiñcidityāderna hariṃ vinā /
analyzed: na ṛte tvat kriyate kiñcid ityādeḥ na harim vinā
translated: Because of statements like nothing is done without you,

analyzed: syāt muktiḥ kasya api hi kvacid
translated: liberation could occur for anyone anywhere, even from the nature of knowledge alone.

analyzed: ajñānām jñāna daḥ viṣṇuḥ jñāninām mokṣa daḥ ca saḥ
translated: Vishnu is the giver of knowledge to the ignorant, and he is the giver of liberation to the wise.

analyzed: ānanda daḥ ca muktānām saḥ eva ekaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: And he alone, Janardana, is the giver of bliss to the liberated.

analyzed: iti ukteḥ bandha mithyātvam nā eva muktiḥ apekṣate
translated: Because of this statement, the unreality of bondage does not depend on liberation at all.

analyzed: mithyātvam api bandhasya na pratyakṣa virodhataḥ
translated: Even the unreality of bondage is not due to contradiction with perception.

analyzed: mithyātvam yadi duḥkha ādeḥ tad vākya agratas bhavet
translated: If the unreality of suffering etc. were to be in front of that statement,

original: mithyāyāḥ sādhakatvaṃ ca na siddhaṃ prativādinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mithyāyāḥ sādhaka tvam ca na siddham prativādinaḥ
translated: and the validity of the unreal is not established for the opponent.

original: tacca mithyāpramāṇena satā vā sādhyate tvayā /
analyzed: tat ca mithyā pramāṇena satā vā sādhyate tvayā
translated: And that is established by you either with a false means of knowledge or with a true one.

original: satā ced dvaitasiddhiḥ syānna siddhaṃ cānyasādhanam // / / //
analyzed: satā ced dvaita siddhiḥ syāt na siddham ca anya sādhanam
translated: If with a true one, there would be the establishment of duality, and the means of establishing the other is not established.

analyzed: sādhaka tvam sataḥ tena sākṣiṇā siddhim icchatā
translated: And that is desired to be established by the witness who desires the establishment of the true means of knowledge.

original: svīkṛtaṃ hyaviśeṣasya sādhyā sādhakatā punaḥ // / / //🔽taccāviśeṣamānena sādhyamityanavasthitiḥ /
analyzed: svīkṛtam hi aviśeṣasya sādhyā sādhaka tā punar  tat ca aviśeṣa mānena sādhyam iti anavasthitiḥ
translated: For one who has accepted the absence of distinction, the probandum is the means of knowledge again.🔽And that is to be established by the means of knowledge of the absence of distinction, thus there is an infinite regress.

analyzed: an aṅgīkurvatām viśva satyatām tat na vādi tā
translated: For those who do not accept the truth of the universe, there is no state of being a proponent.

analyzed: tasmāt vyavahṛtiḥ sarvā satyā iti eva vyavasthitā
translated: Therefore, all usage is indeed established as true.

analyzed: vyāvahārikam etasmāt satyam iti eva ca āgatam
translated: From this, the conventional is indeed come to as true.

analyzed: vyavahāra satas ca api sādhaka tvam tu pūrvavat
translated: And the proof of the conventional truth is also as before.

original: sattraividhyaṃ ca mānena siddhayet keneti pṛcchyate // / / //🔽tasyāpyuktaprakāreṇa naiva siddhiḥ kathañcana /
analyzed: sat traividhyam ca mānena siddhayet kena iti pṛcchyate  tasya api ukta prakāreṇa nā eva siddhiḥ kathañcana
translated: And the threefold nature of existence is to be established by a means of knowledge - by what? thus it is asked.🔽Of that also, in no way whatsoever is there establishment by the method stated.

analyzed: vailakṣaṇyam sat asatoḥ api etena niṣidhyate
translated: The difference between the existent and the non-existent is also denied by this.

analyzed: vailakṣaṇyam sataḥ ca api svayam sat bheda vādinaḥ
translated: And the difference between the existent and the non-existent of the one who himself advocates the difference of existence,

analyzed: asataḥ ca api viśvasya tena aniṣyam katham bhavet
translated: and of the universe which is non-existent - how can that which is undesirable by him be?

analyzed: sarvasmāt iti sat bheda saṃsthitiḥ
translated: If it is also said that the establishment of the difference of existence is from all,

original: sanmātratvaṃ brahmaṇo 'pi tasmāt tadapi no bhavet // / / //
analyzed: sat mātra tvam tasmāt tat api no bhavet
translated: then the mere existence of Brahman would also not be, therefore that also would not be.

analyzed: jñāna bādhya tvam api tu na siddham prativādinaḥ
translated: But the being contradicted by knowledge is also not established for the opponent.

analyzed: vijñātasya anyathā samyak vijñānam hi eva tat matam
translated: For him, the cognition of the known in another way is indeed just knowledge.

analyzed: asat vilakṣaṇa jñaptyai jñātavyam asat eva hi
translated: For the cognition of the different from the non-existent, the non-existent itself is indeed to be known.

analyzed: tasmāt asat pratītiḥ ca katham tena nivāryate
translated: Therefore, how is the cognition of the non-existent also warded off by that?

original: anyathātvamasat tasmād bhrāntāveva pratīyate /🔽sattvasyāsata evaṃ hi svīkāryaiva pratītatā // / / //
analyzed: anyathātvam asat tasmāt bhrāntau eva pratīyate  sattvasya asataḥ evam hi svīkāryā eva pratīta tā
translated: The otherness is unreal, therefore it is cognized only in error.🔽Thus the reality of the non-existent must be accepted as cognition.

analyzed: tasya anirvacanīya tve syāt eva hi anavasthitiḥ
translated: If it were inexpressible, there would indeed be an infinite regress.

analyzed: nirviśeṣe svayam bhāte kim ajñāna āvṛtam bhavetaḥ
translated: When it shines by itself without distinctions, what could be covered by ignorance?

analyzed: mithyā viśeṣaḥ u pi ajñāna siddhim eva hi apekṣate  na ca āvaraṇam ajñānam asatye tena ca iṣyate
translated: Even a false distinction depends on the establishment of ignorance itself.🔽And ignorance is not accepted as a cover for what is unreal.

analyzed: aprakāśa svarūpa tvāt jaḍe jñānam na manyate
translated: Ignorance is not considered to be inert due to its nature of being non-illumination.

analyzed: ajñāna abhāvataḥ śāstram sarvam vyarthībhaviṣyati
translated: If ignorance were unreal, all scriptures would become useless due to the absence of ignorance.

analyzed: ajñānasya ca mithyātvam ajñānāt iti kalpane
translated: If the unreality of ignorance is imagined to be due to ignorance,

analyzed: anavasthitiḥ tathā ca syāt anyonya āśraya tā athavā
translated: there would be an infinite regress, or else there would be mutual dependence.

analyzed: svabhāva ajñāna vādasya nirdoṣa tvāt na tat bhavet
translated: That would not be the case due to the faultlessness of the doctrine of the ignorance of intrinsic nature.

analyzed: avidyā durghaṭa tvam ced syāt ātmā api hi tādṛśaḥ
translated: If it is argued that ignorance is impossible due to the impossibility of ignorance, the self would also be like that.

analyzed: atas dhikāri viṣaya phala yoga ādi varjitam
translated: Therefore, the Māyā doctrine, which is devoid of eligibility, object, result, and connection,

analyzed: ananta doṣa duṣṭam ca heyam māyā matam śubhaiḥ
translated: and which is full of infinite faults, should be abandoned by the virtuous.

analyzed: satya tvāt tena duḥkha ādeḥ pratyakṣeṇa virodhataḥ
translated: Because of the truth of suffering etc., there is contradiction with perception.

original: na brahmatāṃ vaded vedo jīvasya hi kathañcana // / / //
analyzed: na brahma tām vadet vedaḥ jīvasya hi kathañcana
translated: The Veda can never speak of the individual soul as Brahman.

analyzed: yajamāna prastara tvam yathā na arthaḥ śruteḥ bhavet
translated: Just as the meaning of the sacrificial cake being the sacrificer cannot be the meaning of the Vedic text,

original: brahmatvamapi jīvasya pratyakṣasyāviśeṣataḥ // / / //🔽sārvajñyādiguṇaṃ jīvād bhinnaṃ jñāpayati śrutiḥ /
analyzed: brahma tvam api jīvasya pratyakṣasya aviśeṣataḥ  sārvajñya ādi guṇam jīvāt bhinnam jñāpayati śrutiḥ
translated: so also the individual soul being Brahman is not so due to the non-difference of perception.

original: īśaṃ tāmupajīvyaiva vartate hyaikyavādinī // / / //🔽upajīvyavirodhena nāsyāstanmānatā bhavet /
analyzed: īśam tām upajīvya eva vartate hi aikya vādinī  upajīvya virodhena na asyāḥ tad māna tā bhavet
translated: The Vedic text indicates the Lord as different from the individual soul, possessing omniscience and other qualities.

analyzed: svātantrye ca viśiṣṭa tve sthāna matti aikyayoḥ api
translated: The statement of non-difference is based on the Lord, and cannot be the means of valid knowledge due to contradiction with the means of valid knowledge on which it is based.

analyzed: sādṛśye ca aikya vāc samyak sa avakāśā yatheṣyataḥ
translated: Even in the case of non-difference, the statement of non-difference is valid, as desired, due to similarity.

analyzed: avakāśa ujkhitā bheda śrutiḥ na ati balā katham
translated: How can the Vedic statement of difference, which is not contradicted, be stronger?

analyzed: ajñāna asambhavāt eva mithyā bhedaḥ nirākṛtaḥ
translated: The denial of false difference is due to the impossibility of ignorance itself.

analyzed: atas yathārtha bandhasya vinā viṣṇu prasādataḥ
translated: Therefore, since bondage cannot be removed without the grace of Vishnu,

analyzed: anivṛtteḥ tad artham hi jijñāsā atra vidhīyate
translated: the inquiry is enjoined for that purpose.

original: yathā dṛṣṭayā prasannaḥ san rājā bandhāpanodakṛt // / / //
analyzed: yathā dṛṣṭayā prasannaḥ san rājā bandha apanoda kṛt
translated: Just as the king, being pleased by what is seen, releases from bondage,

original: evaṃ dṛṣṭaḥ sa bhagavān kuryād bandhavibhedanam /
analyzed: evam dṛṣṭaḥ sa bhagavān kuryāt bandha vibhedanam
translated: Thus, when that Blessed Lord is seen, he would bring about the breaking of the bondage.

original: kāryatā ca na kācit syādiṣṭasādhanatāṃ vinā // / / //
analyzed: kārya tā ca na kācid syāt iṣṭa sādhana tām vinā
translated: And there would be no purpose at all without the quality of being the means of attaining the desired goal.

original: kāryaṃ na hi kriyāvyāpyaṃ niṣiddhasya samatvataḥ /🔽na bhaviṣyatkriyā kāryaṃ srakṣyatīśa iti hyapi // / / //
analyzed: kāryam na hi kriyā vyāpyam niṣiddhasya sama tvataḥ  na bhaviṣyat kriyā kāryam srakṣyati īśaḥ iti hi api
translated: For an effect is not pervaded by an action, because of the equality of what is prohibited.🔽Nor is the future action to be created, for even the Lord would create it.

analyzed: kāryam syāt nā eva ca a kartum aśakyam kāryam iṣyate
translated: An effect would not be so, and an effect that cannot be made is not accepted.

analyzed: sāmyāt eva niṣiddhasya tat iṣṭam sādhanam tathā
translated: By the same reasoning, that is accepted as the means of attaining what is desired, even of what is prohibited.

analyzed: kāryam sādhanam iṣṭasya bhagavān iṣṭadevatā
translated: The effect is the means of attaining what is desired, the Blessed Lord is the desired deity.

original: mukhyeṣyaṃ vā sumanasāṃ preyastaditi ca śrutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: mukhyeṣyam vā sumanasām preyaḥ tat iti ca śrutiḥ
translated: Or it is to be accepted as the chief, dear to the good-minded, thus says the scripture.

analyzed: prāṇa buddhi manaḥ kha ātma deha apatya dhana ādayaḥ
translated: Life, intellect, mind, happiness, self, body, children, wealth, etc.,

original: yatsamparkāt priyā āsaṃstataḥ ko nvaparaḥ priyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yad samparkāt priyāḥ āsan tatas kaḥ nu aparaḥ priyaḥ
translated: which are dear due to contact with him, who else is dear?

analyzed: ityādi vākyaiḥ ākāṅkṣā sannidhiḥ yogyatā yatas
translated: Thus, from the statements beginning with this, the requirement, proximity, and fitness,

analyzed: asmin eva samastasya iti iṣye vyutpattiḥ iṣyate  atti apūpān tava bhrātā ityādau āvāpataḥ pi ca
translated: from this very, of the whole, the derivation is accepted as desired.🔽Even from the addition of he eats the cakes and so on,

analyzed: udvāpāt vartamāna tvāt ākāṅkṣā ādi balāt api
translated: and from the subtraction, because of the present, and also by the power of requirement and so on.

analyzed: bālaḥ vyutpattim apyeti na anayā ityādi vākyataḥ
translated: The child learns the meaning even from the sentence bring the cow, etc.

analyzed: ānīyamāna dṛṣṭayā eva vyutpatteḥ sambhave sati
translated: When the meaning can be understood by the mere sight of the object being brought,

original: eṣyadānayanāyāyaṃ kuta eva pratīkṣate /🔽vyutpanno vartamāne tu kriyāśabde bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: eṣyat ānayanāya ayam kutas eva pratīkṣate  vyutpannaḥ vartamāne tu kriyā śabde bhaviṣyati
translated: why should he wait for the future bringing?🔽When the child has learned the meaning of the present tense verb,

analyzed: punar dṛṣṭyā eva śabda śrut paścāt vyutpattim eṣyati
translated: he will learn the meaning of the past and future tenses by mere sight,

analyzed: vartamānam atītam ca bhaviṣyat iti ca kramāt
translated: as the past, present and future are in order.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣā ādi yutam yasmāt vidheḥ vyutpādanam kutas
translated: Since the teaching of the injunctive suffix is accompanied by expectancy, etc., how can there be learning?

analyzed: dṛṣṭyā jñāta padārthasya pada ākāṅkṣā bhaviṣyati
translated: For one who has understood the meaning of the words by sight, there will be expectancy of the words.

original: vyutpattiḥ prathamā tasmād vatarmāne gate tataḥ /
analyzed: vyutpattiḥ prathamā tasmāt vatarmāne gate tatas
translated: Therefore, the first learning is from the present, then from the past,

analyzed: iṣṭam ākāṅkṣate sarvaḥ na pravṛttim apekṣate
translated: everyone desires what is desired, not what is undertaken.

analyzed: aparokṣam parokṣam vā jñānam iṣṭasya sādhanam
translated: Knowledge, whether direct or indirect, is the means of what is desired.

analyzed: kvāpi ca iṣyā tad arthā syāt attiḥ hi rasa vittaye
translated: And in some cases, the desire would be for that purpose, for eating is for the sake of taste.

analyzed: vākya artha jñāna mātreṇa kvacid iṣṭam bhavet api
translated: In some cases, the desired result may come even from mere knowledge of the meaning of the sentence.

analyzed: na ca sruka sruva vahnaya ādau atātparyam śruteḥ bhavet
translated: And there would be no purpose in the Vedic injunction regarding the sruk, sruva, fire, etc.

analyzed: yat kiñcid karaṇa rasya api yajña tā eva anyathā bhavet
translated: Even for one who enjoys any means, it would be a sacrifice in another way.

analyzed: tasmāt upāsana artham ca svārthe tātparya vat bhavet
translated: Therefore, for the purpose of worship, it would have relevance in one's own purpose.

analyzed: iti śabda unnaye gnau iti unnīte smṛtiḥ bhavet
translated: When the word 'iti' is raised in the fire, there would be recollection.

analyzed: iti śabda vyapetāni hi api santi vacāṃsi alam
translated: For there are many statements devoid of the word 'iti'.

analyzed: ātmānam eva ityādīni yoge gnau api tat samam
translated: The statements beginning with 'the self alone' are equal even in the combination with fire.

analyzed: eka vākya tva yoge tu vedasya api hi aśeṣatas
translated: But when there is a combination of being one sentence, even of the entire Veda,

original: vākyabhedo na yuktaḥ syād yogaśca syānmahāphale /
analyzed: vākya bhedaḥ na yuktaḥ syāt yogaḥ ca syāt mahā phale
translated: there would be no split of the sentence, and there would be a combination with great fruit.

analyzed: iti brūyāt iti vacaḥ gatam agnau samīpa gam
translated: The statement 'one should say' has gone near the fire.

analyzed: kalpanā gauravam ced syāt pṛthak tātparya sambhave
translated: If there is the heaviness of assumption, then there is the possibility of separate relevance.

analyzed: kalpanā gauravāt eva padārthāḥ na syuḥ eva hi
translated: Due to the heaviness of assumption alone, the meanings of the words would not be there at all.

analyzed: pramāṇa avagata tvam ced tātparyāṇa śam tathā eva hi
translated: If it is argued that there is the nature of being known by valid means of knowledge, then the relevance is just like that.

analyzed: tasmāt padārthe vākya arthe tātparyam ubhayatra ca
translated: Therefore, the relevance is both in the meaning of the words and in the meaning of the sentence.

analyzed: pṛthak eva ca vākya tvam pṛthak anvayataḥ bhavet
translated: And the nature of being a sentence would be separate, and the comprehension would be separate.

analyzed: avāntara tvāt vākyānām vākya bhedaḥ na dūṣaṇam
translated: Due to being subordinate, the split of the sentence is not a fault.

analyzed: aṅgīkṛta tvāt api taiḥ padārthānām pṛthak pṛthak
translated: Even because of their acceptance of the meanings of the words separately,

analyzed: kriyā padena anvayasya vākya bhedāt hi dūṣaṇam  pratyakṣa ādi virodhe gauṇa arthasya api sambhavāt
translated: the connection with the word denoting action is a fault due to the split of the sentence.🔽Therefore, even when there is contradiction with perception etc., the secondary meaning is possible.

analyzed: atātparyam padārthe na kalpyam avirodhataḥ

analyzed: sattvāt tateḥ vaidika tvāt samyak vaktum aśakyataḥ
translated: Because of existence, because of the Vedic origin, because of the impossibility of proper expression,

analyzed: āśraya tvāt sva āśraya tvāt jñāna tvāt durvida tvataḥ
translated: Because of being the substratum, because of being the substratum of itself, because of being knowledge, because of being difficult to know,

analyzed: sattateḥ yātanāt ca eva hi aprāpta tvāt ca durjanaiḥ  nitya asādhu guṇa vyāpti yantṛ rūpa tvataḥ sadā
translated: Because of continuity, because of torment, and because of being unobtainable by the wicked,

analyzed: jagat gatena rūpeṇa brahmā eva hi tathā ucyate
translated: Because of always pervading the qualities of the eternal, because of being the controller, and because of always having a form that moves in the world, Brahman itself is said to be so.

original: vyaktiruktaguṇānāṃ hi puruṣāpekṣayā nṛṇām /🔽bhavedabhavadityādyaḥ prayogaścātra yujyate // / / //
analyzed: vyaktiḥ ukta guṇānām hi puruṣa apekṣayā nṛṇām  bhavet abhavat iti ādyaḥ prayogaḥ ca atra yujyate
translated: For men, the manifestation of the qualities mentioned is dependent on the Purusha.🔽Therefore, the first application of the word is not is appropriate here.

analyzed: tasmāt aśeṣa kartā ekaḥ nirvikāraḥ ramāpatiḥ
translated: Therefore, the one unchanging lord of Lakshmi, the creator of all,

analyzed: śabdaiḥ prakṛtiḥ ityādyaiḥ strī liṅgaiḥ abhidhīyate
translated: is denoted by feminine words such as Prakriti and so on.

analyzed: bahu syām iti tasya eva hi ukta mārgeṇa yujyate
translated: Let me be many is appropriate for him in the manner stated.

original: tattadgatena rūpeṇa tadarthaṃ hyasṛjajjagat // / / //🔽yaccāvikṛtamevaitad brahma viśvātmanā mṛṣā /
analyzed: tad tad gatena rūpeṇa tad artham hi asṛjat jagat  yat ca avikṛtam eva etat brahma viśvātmanā mṛṣā
translated: He created the world for that purpose with that and that form.

original: dṛśyate mandadṛṣṭayaiva sa sarga iti kathyate // / / //🔽sā mandadṛṣṭistasyaiva brahmaṇaḥ kiṃ tato 'nyagā /
analyzed: dṛśyate manda dṛṣṭayā eva sa sargaḥ iti kathyate  sā manda dṛṣṭiḥ tasya eva brahmaṇaḥ kim tatas
translated: And that which is seen by the dull-sighted as Brahman itself, unchanged, falsely as the universe, is called creation.🔽Is that dull sight of his Brahman or is it elsewhere?

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ ced kva sārvajñyam anya gā ced svatas
translated: If it is of Brahman, where is His omniscience? If it is elsewhere, it is different from Him.

analyzed: na a deha yoginaḥ dṛṣṭiḥ iti tat kāraṇam svatas
translated: The view of those not united with the body is that the cause is self-existent.

original: dehinaḥ kāraṇayutā dehāśca yadi na bhramāt // / / //
analyzed: dehinaḥ kāraṇa yutāḥ dehāḥ ca yadi na bhramāt
translated: If embodied beings and bodies are not illusory,

original: kiṃ bhrāntikalpitaṃ tatra bhedo 'pi bhramajo yadi /
analyzed: kim bhrānti kalpitam tatra bhedaḥ bhrama jaḥ yadi
translated: then if the difference is also born of illusion, what is imagined by illusion?

analyzed: bhrānteḥ ajñāna mūla tvāt tasya bheda vyapekṣayā
translated: Since illusion has ignorance as its root, and that depends on difference,

analyzed: na ajñāna kalpakam kiñcid anyonya āśraya tā yatas  bhrama tve tu iyam uktiḥ ca tad antar patanāt na hi
translated: there is nothing that can be imagined by ignorance, because of mutual dependence.🔽If it were illusory, this statement would not be so, because it would fall within that.

analyzed: vyāvahārika tā ca asya syāt abādhya tve eva hi
translated: And its conventional nature would be only due to its being unnegated.

original: bādhyaṃ nārthakriyākāri na ca svapno 'pi no mṛṣā // / / //🔽vāsanājanitatvena tasyāpyaṅgīkṛtatvataḥ /
analyzed: bādhyam na arthakriyā kāri na ca no mṛṣā  vāsanā janita tvena tasya api aṅgīkṛta tvataḥ
translated: What is negated does not perform a function, and even a dream is not false.🔽Because it is accepted as being born from latent impressions.

original: sa hi karteti vākyācca jāgrattvamiti hi bhramaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa hi kartā iti vākyāt ca jāgrat tvam iti hi bhramaḥ
translated: And because of the statement He is the agent, the notion that it is waking is an illusion.

analyzed: sarpa bhrama ādau api hi jñānam asti eva tādṛśam
translated: Even in the illusion of a snake, there is such knowledge.

analyzed: tat eva artha kriyā kāri tat sat eva artha kārakam
translated: That itself performs a function, and that alone is the existent that performs a purpose.

original: brahma tvarthakriyākāri parataḥ svata eva vā /
analyzed: brahma tu arthakriyā kāri paratas svatas eva vā
translated: Brahman, however, performs a function either from another or by itself.

original: aṅgīkṛtaṃ hi tenaiva paratastve na ca pramā // / / //
analyzed: aṅgīkṛtam hi tena eva paratas tve na ca pramā
translated: For that itself has accepted it. In the case of dependence on another, there is no valid cognition.

analyzed: amukhya satya mānasya sādhaka tve sadā āvayoḥ
translated: If the truth of the primary object is accepted by both of us as the means of valid knowledge,

original: na hi sampratipattiḥ syādatastiṣṭhatu sā pramā // / / //
analyzed: na hi sampratipattiḥ syāt atas tiṣṭhatu sā pramā
translated: then there can be no agreement between us. Therefore, let that valid cognition remain as it is.

original: na hi vipratipannena śakyaṃ sādhayituṃ kvacit /🔽sādhakatvaṃ tu satyasya sākṣiṇo hyāvayordvayoḥ /
analyzed: na hi vipratipannena śakyam sādhayitum kvacid  sādhaka tvam tu satyasya sākṣiṇaḥ hi āvayoḥ dvayoḥ
translated: For one who disagrees cannot establish anything anywhere.🔽But the truth as the means of valid knowledge is well-known to both of us, the witnesses.

analyzed: samyak sampratipannam tat na bhavet
translated: That cannot be disputed by us.

analyzed: yadi nā aṅgīkṛtam kiñcid anaṅgīkṛtatā api hi
translated: If nothing is accepted, then even the state of not being accepted

analyzed: na aṅgīkṛtā iti mūkaḥ syāt iti na asmad vivādi tā
translated: is not accepted. Thus one would be silent. Therefore, we do not dispute with ourselves.

original: viśvaṃ satyaṃ yacciketa praghānvasya yathārthataḥ /🔽ityādiśrutayaḥ sarvā viśvasatyatvavācakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: viśvam satyam yat ciketa praghā anvasya yathārthataḥ  ityādi śrutayaḥ sarvāḥ viśva satya tva vācakāḥ
translated: One who knows the truth of the universe as it really is,🔽He who knows the truth of the universe as it really is,

analyzed: satya tvam gagana ādeḥ ca sākṣi pratyakṣa sādhitam
translated: The truth of the sky and so on is established by the perception of the witness.

original: sākṣisiddhasya na kvāpi bādhyatvaṃ tadadoṣataḥ // / / //🔽savarkāleṣvabādhyatvaṃ sākṣiṇaiva pratīyate /
analyzed: sākṣi siddhasya na kvāpi bādhya tvam tad adoṣataḥ  sava ṛkāleṣu abādhya tvam sākṣiṇā eva pratīyate
translated: What is established by the witness is never contradicted anywhere, because that is faultless.🔽The non-contradictedness in all times is perceived only by the witness.

original: kālo hi sākṣipratyakṣaḥ suṣuptau ca pratītitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kālaḥ hi sākṣi pratyakṣaḥ suṣuptau ca pratītitaḥ
translated: For time is perceived by the witness, and in deep sleep it is known.

analyzed: atīta anāgatau kālau api na a sākṣi gocarau
translated: Even the past and future times are not beyond the reach of the witness.

analyzed: pakṣīkartum aśakya tvāt na anumā tatra vartate
translated: Inference does not operate there, because it is incapable of being inferred.

original: tadetaditi sarvaṃ ca dṛśyaṃ vā smṛtigocaram /
analyzed: tat etat iti sarvam ca dṛśyam vā smṛti gocaram
translated: And all this visible world or the object of memory

analyzed: sākṣi siddhena kālena khacitam hi eva vartate
translated: is indeed pervaded by time established by the witness.

original: tasmānna taṃ vinā kiñcit smartuṃ draṣṭumathāpi vā /
analyzed: tasmāt na tam vinā kiñcid smartum draṣṭum atha api vā
translated: Therefore, without it, nothing can be remembered or seen.

analyzed: śakyam tat nitya siddheḥ hi na anumā avasaraḥ bhavet
translated: For the establishment of that [time] is eternal, so there is no opportunity for inference.

analyzed: atas doṣa pratītasya satya tvam sākṣiṇā matam
translated: Therefore, the truth of what is perceived without fault is considered by the witness.

original: parīkṣādeśca satyatvaṃ tena hyeva mataṃ bhavet // / / //
analyzed: parīkṣā ādeḥ ca satya tvam tena hi eva matam bhavet
translated: And the truth of examination is considered to be by that [witness] itself.

analyzed: anyathā śruti yuktayā ādi pramāṇaiḥ ca saha eva tu
translated: Otherwise, if there were a sudden cessation of the world along with the scriptures, reasoning, and other means of knowledge,

original: akasmād vinivṛttiśca kiṃ viśvasya na śaṅkayate // / / //
analyzed: akasmāt vinivṛttiḥ ca kim viśvasya na śaṅkayate
translated: why is the possibility of the world not suspected?

original: itaḥ pūrvaṃ tathābhāvād yadi no saṃsṛtergatiḥ /
analyzed: itas pūrvam tathābhāvāt yadi no saṃsṛteḥ gatiḥ
translated: If there is no way out of saṃsāra before this [time],

analyzed: vākya anumāditaḥ ced syāt tad prāmāṇyam ca sākṣitaḥ
translated: if it were from the scriptures, inference, etc., then the validity of those [means of knowledge] is from the witness.

analyzed: tad prāmāṇyam yathā sākṣī sthāpayati evam eva hi
translated: Just as the witness establishes the validity of those [means of knowledge],

analyzed: sarva kāleṣu api sthairyāt vyabhicāram apohya ca
translated: in the same way, by removing deviation due to stability at all times,

analyzed: evam akṣa jamāna tva siddhām viśvasya satya tām
translated: thus the truth of the world, established by the cognition arising from the senses,

analyzed: kim iti sthāpayet na ayam nirdoṣa jñāna śaktitaḥ
translated: Why would he not establish it, due to the power of faultless knowledge?

analyzed: eka jñāna kṛtam viśvam iti yat coṣyate mṛṣā
translated: And what is falsely asserted that the universe is created by a single knowledge,

analyzed: bahu jñāna kṛtam viśvam iti tasya uttaram bhavet
translated: the answer to that would be that the universe is created by multiple knowledges.

analyzed: parasya satya tām jānan api yaḥ sva ātma taskaraḥ
translated: Even knowing the truth of the other, if one is a thief of one's own self

analyzed: paras na asti iti vadati kim iti unmatta vat vadet
translated: and says the other does not exist, why would one speak like a madman?

original: parābhāve hi vāg vyarthā yadi naivocyate tadā /
analyzed: parābhāve hi vāc vyarthā yadi nā evā ucyate tadā
translated: If the other is absent, speech is pointless, if it is not spoken at all,

analyzed: kaśā vetra ādikam tasya taskarasya uttaram vadet
translated: then a stick or whip, etc. would be the answer for that thief.

original: prapañco yadi vidyeta nivarteta na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: prapañcaḥ yadi vidyeta nivarteta na saṃśayaḥ
translated: If the world existed, it would cease without a doubt.

analyzed: māyā mātram idam dvaitam advaitam paramārthataḥ
translated: This duality is mere illusion, non-duality is the ultimate truth.

analyzed: vikalpaḥ vinivarteta kalpitaḥ yadi kenacid
translated: If an option were to be imagined by someone, it would cease.

analyzed: upadeśāt ayam vādaḥ jñāte dvaitam na vidyate
translated: This statement is due to instruction, in the unknown duality does not exist.

original: ityatra yadiśabdau ca nivarteteti ca dvayam /
analyzed: iti atra yadi śabdau ca nivarteta iti ca dvayam
translated: Here, the words if and the two would cease

analyzed: viśvasya satya tām āhuḥ vidyeta utpattim eva ca
translated: they say the truth of the universe and also its origination from existence.

analyzed: vidā utpattau iti hi asmāt dhātoḥ utpattiḥ eva hi
translated: For from this verbal root vid (to exist), origination itself is (the meaning).
The universe is mostly pervaded by Nivritti (unmanifest state), and is of five kinds of differences.

original: jīveśvarabhidā caiva jaḍeśvarabhidā tathā /🔽jīvabhedo mithaścaiva jaḍajīvabhidā tathā /
analyzed: jīva īśvara bhidā ca eva jaḍa īśvara bhidā tathā  jīva bhedaḥ mithas ca eva jaḍa jīva bhidā tathā
translated: The difference between the individual soul and God, the difference between the insentient and God,🔽The difference among individual souls, the difference between the insentient and individual souls,

analyzed: mithas ca jaḍa bhedaḥ yaḥ prapañcaḥ bheda pañcakaḥ
translated: And the difference among the insentient - this is the fivefold universe.

analyzed: saḥ yam satyaḥ hi anādiḥ ca sādiḥ ced nāśam āpnuyāt
translated: This is true and beginningless. If it had a beginning, it would be subject to destruction.

original: dvaitaṃ na vidyata iti tasmādajñānināṃ matam // / / //
analyzed: dvaitam na vidyate iti tasmāt ajñāninām matam
translated: Therefore, the opinion of the ignorant is that duality does not exist.

analyzed: iti śruteḥ mitam trātam māyā ākhya hari vidyayā
translated: Thus, the limited is protected by the knowledge of Hari called Maya.

analyzed: uttamaḥ rthaḥ hariḥ tu ekaḥ tad anyat madhya mādhyamam
translated: Hari alone is the highest object, others are of medium and inferior status.

original: vācārabdhaṃ tu sāṅketyaṃ nāma syād vikṛtaṃ bahu /
analyzed: vācā ārabdham tu sāṅketyam nāma syāt vikṛtam bahu
translated: The artificial name is that which is begun with words, and is manifold.

original: nityaṃ tu nāmadheyaṃ yanmṛttiketyādi vaidikam // / / //🔽prādhānyāt tatparijñānāt prākṛtājño 'pi pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: nityam tu nāmadheyam yat mṛttikā ityādi vaidikam  prādhānyāt tad parijñānāt prākṛta ājñaḥ pi pūruṣaḥ
translated: But the eternal name is that which is Vedic, like mrittika (earth).

analyzed: vidvān iti ucyate sadbhiḥ evam nitya para ātma vid
translated: Even a person ignorant of Prakrit is called learned by the good because of his knowledge of the principal, thus knowing the eternal supreme Self.

analyzed: sadātanam satyam iti nityam eva ucyate budhaiḥ
translated: The eternal is always said to be true by the wise.

analyzed: prayogaḥ ca uttaratra asti jarā yadi enam āpnuyāt
translated: And there is the application in the next verse: If old age would overtake him...

analyzed: dehaḥ pradhvaṃsate vā ayam kim syā atiśiṣyate
translated: This body perishes. What then remains of it?

original: hanyate na vadhenāyaṃ jarayā ca na jīryati // / / //
analyzed: hanyate na vadhena ayam jarayā ca na jīryati
translated: It is not killed by death, nor does it grow old by old age.

original: etat satyaṃ brahmapuramiti nityatva eva hi /
analyzed: etat satyam brahma puram iti nitya tve eva hi
translated: This is indeed the truth, that the city of Brahman is eternal.

analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇam iti ukte mithyā iti aśruta kalpanam
translated: When it is said to be mere verbal expression, it is an unheard assumption that it is false.

original: punaruktirnāmadheyamitītyasya nirarthatā /🔽ekaḥ piṇḍo maṇiśceti padavaiyathyarmeva ca // / / //
analyzed: punaruktiḥ nāmadheyam iti iti asya nirartha tā  ekaḥ piṇḍaḥ maṇiḥ ca iti pada vaiyathya ṛm eva ca
translated: The word punarukta (tautology) is meaningless.🔽And the word is defective, like ekapiṇḍa and maṇi.

analyzed: vikāra tva vivakṣāyām na ca eka nakha kṛntanam
translated: And in the intention of being a modification, there is no single nail-clipping.

original: sarvakārṣṇāyasaṃ ca syādataḥ sādṛśya eva ca // / / //
analyzed: sarva kārṣṇāyasam ca syāt atas sādṛśye eva ca
translated: And it would be all made of black iron. Therefore, it is only in similarity.

analyzed: vivakṣā atra tu nitya tve prādhānye ca ukta vartmanā
translated: But here, the intention is of eternality and predominance in the way stated.

analyzed: prādhānya pratipatti artham sṛṣṭayā ādeḥ ca eva vistaraḥ
translated: And the elaboration of creation etc. is for the purpose of understanding predominance.

original: tasmāt kenāpi mārgeṇa na vivartamataṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tasmāt kena api mārgeṇa na vivarta matam bhavet
translated: Therefore, by any means, the doctrine of manifestation should not be.

analyzed: heyam eva śubha arthibhiḥ
translated: That, which has innumerable faults, should be abandoned by those who desire good.

analyzed: asaṅkhaya tvena doṣāṇām grantha ādhikya bhayāt api
translated: Due to the fear of the text being too long, even though the faults are innumerable,

analyzed: uparamyate tatas viṣṇuḥ icchā pūrvakam aśramaḥ
translated: Therefore, Vishnu, who is free from exertion, acts according to His will.

analyzed: karoti pitṛ vat viśvam pūrṇa śeṣa guṇa ātmakaḥ
translated: He acts towards the universe like a father, being of the nature of the remaining qualities in their entirety.

analyzed: iti śrīmat ānandatīrtha bhagavat pāda ācārya viracite śrīmat brahmasūtra anuvyākhyāne prathamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter in the Anuvyakhyana of the revered Brahmasutras composed by the illustrious Anandatirtha, the illustrious Acharya.

analyzed: uktaḥ samanvayaḥ sākṣāt avirodhaḥ tra sādhyate
translated: Direct concomitance has been stated. Here, non-contradiction is to be established.

analyzed: caturvidhasya tasya ādau yauktaḥ tatra api ca smṛteḥ
translated: Of that fourfold [concomitance], the first is logical. There also, of Smriti.

analyzed: tasyāḥ catur svarūpa tvāt pratyekam catur ātmakāḥ
translated: And because that [Smriti] has a fourfold nature, each [of the four padas] has four aspects.

analyzed: pādāḥ sarve tad aṃśāḥ ca mūrtīnām varṇam āgamāt
translated: All the padas and their parts are of the form of the incarnations, according to the Varna-ma-agama.

analyzed: āpta tā sama tā dṛṣṭi śruti sāmya balāt bhavāḥ
translated: Appropriateness, equality, similarity of vision, similarity of scripture, strength,

analyzed: sarva anusāraḥ laghu tā viśeṣa adarśana aphale
translated: Universal conformity, brevity, non-perception of difference, non-perception of result,

analyzed: iṣṭa siddhiḥ ca niyamaḥ pūrvapakṣeṣu yuktayaḥ
translated: Accomplishment of the desired, restriction - these are the reasons in the prima facie views.

analyzed: etāḥ eva tu atibalā siddhāntasya niyāmakāḥ
translated: But these very [reasons] are the strongest determiners of the conclusion.

original: āptaiḥ pratyakṣato dṛṣṭvā proktamarthaṃ kathaṃ śratiḥ /
analyzed: āptaiḥ pratyakṣatas dṛṣṭvā proktam artham katham śratiḥ
translated: How can the scripture, which has been stated by the adepts as seen by direct perception,

analyzed: pipīlikā lipi nibhāḥ vārayeta sarva gāḥ hi te
translated: Be rejected? For they are all-pervading like the writing of ants.

analyzed: iti ced yadi aśeṣa jñāḥ rudra ādyāḥ hari pūrvakāḥ
translated: If it is argued that if Rudra and others, headed by Hari, are the knowers of all,

original: kiṃ nāśeṣavido mānaṃ hy ubhayatra samaṃ bhavet // / / //
analyzed: kim nā aśeṣa vidaḥ mānam hi ubhayatra samam bhavet
translated: Why should not the entire knower be the authority, as the authority would be equal in both cases?

analyzed: na ca āpti niścayaḥ tatra śakyate vyabhicārataḥ
translated: And there can be no ascertainment of attainment there, due to the possibility of error.

analyzed: na ca asyāḥ vyabhicāre hīyate māna tā kvacid
translated: And even in the case of its error, its authoritativeness is not diminished anywhere.

analyzed: veda uktasya adhikārasya durnirūpa tvataḥ sadā
translated: Because the eligibility mentioned in the Veda is always difficult to determine,

original: niyamo vyabhicāro vā naiva jñātuṃ hi śakyate // / / //
analyzed: niyamaḥ vyabhicāraḥ vā nā eva jñātum hi śakyate
translated: the rule or exception cannot be known at all.

analyzed: adhikāraḥ hi sulabhaḥ kathitaḥ nyāgameṣu alam
translated: For eligibility is easily declared in other scriptures,

original: vedokto hy adhikārastu durlabhaḥ sarvamānuṣaiḥ // / / //🔽anyāgameṣu vipratvamapi caṇḍālajanmanām /
analyzed: veda uktaḥ hi adhikāraḥ tu durlabhaḥ sarva mānuṣaiḥ  anya āgameṣu vipra tvam api caṇḍāla janmanām
translated: but the eligibility mentioned in the Veda is difficult for all human beings to attain.

analyzed: maṇḍala antar praveśena kramaśas pratipādyate
translated: Even for those born as outcastes, the status of a Brahmin is taught gradually by entering the sacred circle in other scriptures.

original: adhikāraṃ durāpādyamuktavātisulabhaṃ punaḥ /🔽aśakyaṃ sādhanaṃ coktavā suśakaṃ tatphalāptaye /
analyzed: adhikāram durāpādya muktavan ati sulabham punar  aśakyam sādhanam ca uktavā su śakam tad phala āptaye
translated: Having said that eligibility is difficult to attain, he again says it is very easy.🔽Having said that the means is impossible, he says it is very easy to attain its fruit.

original: ucyate 'tastaduktaṃ hi vyabhicāri phale 'pi tu // / / //🔽kathaṃ pramāṇatāṃ gacchennityatvāt puruṣodbhavaiḥ /
analyzed: ucyate hi vyabhicāri phale tu  katham pramāṇa tām gacchet nitya tvāt puruṣa udbhavaiḥ
translated: Therefore, what was said is stated to be fallible even in the result.🔽How can it be authoritative, being eternal, not arising from a person?

original: ujkhitaṃ sarvadoṣaiśca kathaṃ no mānatāṃ vrajet // / / //
analyzed: ujkhitam sarva doṣaiḥ ca katham naḥ māna tām vrajet
translated: And being free from all faults, how can it not become authoritative?

analyzed: virūpa nityayā vācā nityayā anityayā sadā
translated: By the eternal and non-eternal words of the Vedas, it is always said.

analyzed: ityādi śrutibhiḥ vedaḥ nityaḥ iti avagamyate

analyzed: yathā drauṇeḥ ulūkena kṛtam api āsa bodhakam

analyzed: a viruddham viruddham tu virodhāt eva bādhitam

analyzed: virodha adarśanāt tasmāt veda prāmāṇyam iṣyate

analyzed: āgama eka pramāṇeṣu tasya eva hi upajīvya tā

analyzed: yuktaḥ yuktaḥ ca yadi arthaḥ āgamasya pratīyate

analyzed: vyāptiḥ pratyakṣa tā yasyāḥ yukti gā āgama gā tathā

analyzed: pratyakṣa āgama mūlā tu yuktiḥ tatra balīyasī

analyzed: yāthārthyam eva māna tvam tat mukhyam jñāna śabdayoḥ

analyzed: artha tvam arya tā eva syāt na kriyā artheṣu sā matā

translated: In the case of knowledge, being an object of knowledge is primary, in the case of the meaning of a word, it is secondary.🔽Reasonings are considered to be in accordance with reality if they generate knowledge in accordance with reality.

analyzed: anupramāṇam etāni hi akṣa yukti vacāṃsi atas
translated: These means of knowledge, such as perception and reasoning, are indeed subsequent means of knowledge.

analyzed: prāmāṇyam na anuvādasya smṛteḥ api vihīyate

analyzed: yāthārthyam eva prāmāṇya śabda arthaḥ yat vivakṣitaḥ
translated: If the meaning of the word validity is intended to be only being in accordance with reality,

analyzed: tṛṇa ādi darśane kim ca phalavat tvam nigadyate

analyzed: nirdoṣa akṣa udbhavam hi atra pratyakṣam iti gīyate

analyzed: prākṛtam śuddha caitanyam akṣam tu dvividham matam

analyzed: śuddham īśa ramā mukteṣu anyatra prākṛtaiḥ yutam

analyzed: nirdoṣam eva caitanyam anyatra ubhayam iṣyate
translated: And consciousness without faults is accepted in other cases,

analyzed: sukha duḥkha ādi viṣayam śuddham saṃsāra geṣu api

analyzed: nirdoṣa tva atiniyamāt tat baliṣṭhatamam matam

translated: The natural one is said to be of six kinds due to the division of the five senses and the mind.🔽Inference is said to be reasoning itself, but it is remembered to be only the pervasion.

analyzed: yadi smāraka mātram syāt smartuḥ na atra prayojanam

analyzed: na pañca avayoktau ca vivāda avasitiḥ bhavet

analyzed: tridhā eva syāt pratijñā artha viruddha tā

analyzed: liṅga rāhityam avyāptiḥ nyūna ādhikye tu vācike

analyzed: sādhya vyāpaka vailomyam avyāptiḥ sādhanasya ca
translated: The absence of the reason in what is pervaded by the probandum, and the over-extension of the reason,

analyzed: durbalena virodhe na pramāṇam asādhakam

analyzed: sva vākyena virodhe na eva sādhaka tām vrajet
translated: Even in contradiction with one's own statement, it would not become a proof.

analyzed: saṃvāda anukti saṃyuktāḥ ete eva ca nigrahāḥ

analyzed: sva artham para artham api vā tattva nirṇaya sādhanī

analyzed: kevalam tu kathā vādaḥ jalpaḥ rtha ādi vyapekṣayā

analyzed: a prakāśya sva siddhāntam asatām pakṣa dūṣaṇam
