translated: For Brahma, it is just that much, for fifty kalpas for Brahma,

analyzed: rudrasya viṃśat eva syāt indrasya arka ādike daśa
translated: for Rudra it would be just twenty, for Indra it is ten in the Arka [kalpa], etc.

analyzed: anyeṣām brahma mātrasya tu antaḥ ārabdha saṅkṣayaḥ
translated: For others, the exhaustion of the begun [karmas] is just the measure of Brahma.

analyzed: brahmaṇā eva saha atas ca param nārāyaṇam vrajet
translated: And along with Brahma, he would go to the supreme Narayana.

analyzed: iti sat tattva vacanam svayam bhagavatā uditam
translated: Thus, the statement about the truth of existence is uttered by the Lord Himself.

analyzed: iti śrīmat ānandatīrtha bhagavat pāda ācārya viracite śrīmat brahmasūtra anuvyākhyāne caturtha adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter of the fourth section in the Anuvyakhyana of the Vedanta sutras composed by the great Acharya Sriman Anandatirtha.

analyzed: devānām ca manuṣyāṇām etāvat samam eva hi
translated: For gods and humans, this is indeed equal.

original: utkrāntimārgau devānāṃ na prāyeṇa bhaviṣyataḥ // / / //🔽karmakṣayasatathotkrāntirmārgo bhogaścatuṣyayam /
analyzed: utkrānti mārgau devānām na prāyeṇa bhaviṣyataḥ  karma kṣaya sa tathā utkrāntiḥ mārgaḥ bhogaḥ catuṣi ayam
translated: The paths of departure for gods will not be common.

original: phalaṃ mokṣa iti proktaḥ kramāt pādeṣu coditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: phalam mokṣaḥ iti proktaḥ kramāt pādeṣu ca uditaḥ
translated: The four-fold fruit of liberation is said to be mentioned in the sections, namely the exhaustion of karma, departure, path, and enjoyment.

original: sraṣṭṛṣveva tu sṛjyānāṃ praveśo brahmaṇo laye /
analyzed: sraṣṭṛṣu eva tu sṛjyānām praveśaḥ brahmaṇaḥ laye
translated: But in the case of creators, the entry of the created beings into Brahma at the time of dissolution,

analyzed: devānām mārgaḥ uddiṣṭaḥ na arciḥ ādiḥ na ca utkramaḥ
translated: the path of the gods is mentioned, not the path of light etc., nor the departure.

analyzed: sraṣṭuḥ tu grāsa bhūtasya dehaḥ tatra layam vrajet
translated: The body of the creator, which is the food, would dissolve into that.

analyzed: yatas sṛjyasya devasya nā evā utkrāntiḥ tatas bhavet
translated: Since there is no departure for the deity to be created from that.

analyzed: layāt ca eva arciḥ ādīnām lokānām api sarvaśas
translated: And also due to the dissolution of the light etc. and all the worlds,

original: kathaṃ mārgo bhavet teṣāṃ viśatāmuttamaṃ svataḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham mārgaḥ bhavet teṣām viśatām uttamam svatas
translated: How would there be a path for them, entering the highest by themselves?

original: jātānāṃ mānuṣe loke devānāṃ ca kadācana /
analyzed: jātānām mānuṣe loke devānām ca kadācana
translated: For those born in the human world and sometimes for the gods,

analyzed: utkrānti mārgau bhavataḥ na tadā muktiḥ iṣyate
translated: The paths of departure and entry exist, but then liberation is not considered.

original: anyeṣāmapi sākṣāttu muktiḥ prāpyāpi taṃ harim /
analyzed: anyeṣām api sākṣāt tu muktiḥ prāpya api tam harim
translated: But for others, even after attaining that Hari,

analyzed: saha eva brahmaṇā bhūyāt iti śāstrasya nirṇayaḥ
translated: Liberation would be with Brahman itself - this is the conclusion of the scriptures.

analyzed: kṣmā ambhaḥ nala anila viyat mana indriyārtha bhūta ādibhiḥ parivṛtaḥ pratisañjighṛkṣuḥ
translated: When desiring to withdraw, surrounded by earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, senses, objects, elements, etc.,

original: avyākṛtaṃ viśati yarhi guṇatrayātmā kālaṃ paraṃ svamanubhūya paraḥ svayambhūḥ // / / //
analyzed: avyākṛtam viśati yarhi guṇa traya ātmā kālam param svam anubhūya paraḥ svayambhūḥ
translated: The Supreme Self, consisting of the three qualities, enters the unmanifest, experiences its own highest time, and becomes the self-existent Supreme.

original: evaṃ paretya bhagavantamanupraviṣṭā ye yogino jitamarunmanaso virāgāḥ /
analyzed: evam paretya bhagavantam anupraviṣṭāḥ ye yoginaḥ jita marut manasaḥ virāgāḥ
translated: Thus, the yogis who have entered the Lord after departing, whose minds are conquered, who are free from attachment,

original: tenaiva sākamamṛtaṃ puruṣaṃ purāṇaṃ brahma pradhānamupayāntyagatābhimānāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena eva sākam amṛtam puruṣam purāṇam brahma pradhānam upayānti agata abhimānāḥ
translated: Along with that, those who have attained the state of being beyond the sense of ego, reach the immortal, ancient Purusha, the Brahman, the Primordial.

analyzed: bhagavantam anuprāptāḥ api tu brahmaṇā saha
translated: Even those who have attained the Lord, however, along with Brahman,

analyzed: paramam mokṣam āyānti liṅga bhaṅgena yoginaḥ
translated: the yogis attain the highest liberation through the dissolution of the linga.

original: prāptā api paraṃ devaṃ sahaiva brahmaṇā punaḥ /
analyzed: prāptāḥ api param devam saha eva brahmaṇā punar
translated: Even those who have attained the supreme God along with Brahman again,

analyzed: ānanda vyaktiyā āyānti pūrṇām liṅgasya bhaṅgataḥ
translated: attain the fullness of bliss through the dissolution of the linga.

analyzed: iti śruti purāṇa ukti balāt vijñāyate ca tat
translated: This is known from the power of the statements of the Vedas and Puranas.

analyzed: bhogaḥ tu sarva devānām nara ādīnām ca vidyate
translated: But the enjoyment of all the gods and men etc. exists.

analyzed: tatra praveśaḥ devānām uttarottarataḥ kramāt
translated: There, the entry of the gods is in the ascending order, one after the other.

analyzed: ucyate deha gānām ca vṛttīnām evam eva tu
translated: It is said that the same is the case with the functions residing in the body.

analyzed: tatra mokṣa svarūpam tu vādinaḥ pratibhā āśrayāt
translated: There, the nature of liberation is spoken of by the disputants based on their own intellect.

original: nānā vadanti puṃsāṃ hi matayo guṇabhedataḥ /
analyzed: nānā vadanti puṃsām hi matayaḥ guṇa bhedataḥ
translated: The opinions of men differ due to the difference in their qualities.

analyzed: pṛthak pṛthak prajāyante tamasā eva anyathāmatiḥ
translated: They arise separately, the mind being otherwise due to tamas.

analyzed: rajasā miśra buddhi tvam sattvena eva yathā matiḥ
translated: The mind is mixed with rajas, and the intellect is as it is due to sattva.

analyzed: guṇa atītā vimuktānām matiḥ śuddha citiḥ yatas
translated: The mind of the liberated ones who are beyond the qualities is pure consciousness, because it is so.

analyzed: sāmyak eva atha nityā ca tad tad māhātmya yogataḥ
translated: And always equal, and eternal, due to the yoga of that greatness.

original: bahaḷā cātiviśadā spaṣṭā caiva śriyo matiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bahaḷā ca ati viśadā spaṣṭā ca eva śriyaḥ matiḥ
translated: The intellect of Lakshmi is very extensive, very clear, and very manifest.

analyzed: mahāśuddhaciti tvena
translated: And due to having a very pure consciousness, it is even more conscious than that.

analyzed: aśeṣa ūru viśeṣāṇām ati spaṣṭa tayā dṛśiḥ
translated: The vision of all the great distinctions is very clear.

analyzed: nityam eka prakārā ca nārāyaṇa matiḥ parā
translated: And always of one kind, the supreme intellect of Narayana.

analyzed: sūrya prabhāvat akhilam bhāsayanti nirantarā
translated: Like the sun's rays, it illuminates everything continuously.

analyzed: nirlepā vīta doṣā ca nityam evā avikāriṇī
translated: Free from attachment, devoid of faults, and always unchanging.

analyzed: viśeṣān a tad gatān tyaktavā prāyas tad lakṣaṇā śriyaḥ
translated: Having abandoned the specific states present in that, it is mostly characterized by Lakshmi.

analyzed: tathā eva spaṣṭa tā bhāvāt tad tantra tvāt ca kevalam
translated: And in the same way, due to the absence of clarity and dependence on that alone,

original: na tādṛśī brahmaṇastu prāya eva śriyo yathā // / / //
analyzed: na tādṛśī brahmaṇaḥ tu prāyas eva śriyaḥ yathā
translated: Brahma's is not like that of Lakshmi, mostly.

analyzed: muktānām tu tad anyeṣām samudra taraḷa upamā
translated: But for the liberated ones other than that, it is like the ocean's waves.

analyzed: agni jvālā vat eva syāt smṛti gānām dṛśaḥ bhavaḥ
translated: The vision of those who remember would be like the flames of fire.

analyzed: evaṃvidheṣu jñāneṣu tamasā muṣya dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: In such knowledges, those whose vision is covered by darkness,

analyzed: khadyota sadṛśa ati alpa jñāna tvāt anyathādṛśaḥ
translated: Due to having very little knowledge like a firefly, see otherwise.

analyzed: vadanti vādinaḥ mokṣam nānā mata samāśrayāt
translated: The disputants speak of liberation based on various doctrines.

analyzed: āśritya pratibhām āha jinaḥ tatra ati tāmasīm
translated: The Victorious One, relying on that intuition, has declared it to be the most extreme darkness.

analyzed: jñānāt karma kṣayāt mokṣaḥ bhavet deha ākhya pañjarāt
translated: Liberation would come from the cage called the body through knowledge and the destruction of karma.🔽Like a bird released from a cage, moving in the sky and in the wind,

analyzed: nityam ūrdhvam vrajati eva pudgalaḥ hasta pādavān
translated: the individual, having hands and feet, always goes upwards.

original: iti tat kena mānena mokṣarūpaṃ pradṛśyate /
analyzed: iti tat kena mānena mokṣa rūpam pradṛśyate
translated: Thus, by what valid cognition is the form of liberation seen?

analyzed: gatiḥ ūrdhvā ca duḥkha itā gati tvāt laukikī yathā
translated: The upward movement is painful, because it is a movement, like a worldly movement.

original: ityukte cānumānaikaśaraṇasya kimuttaram // / / //🔽anūrdhvagatitā tatra yadyupādhiḥ khagasya ca /
analyzed: iti ukte ca anumāna eka śaraṇasya kim uttaram  anūrdhva gati tā tatra yadi upādhiḥ khagasya ca
translated: When this is said, what is the reply of one who relies solely on inference?🔽If the bird's upward movement there is qualified by having a body,

original: dūrordhvagamane duḥkhamiti sādhyānugo na saḥ // / / //🔽pratisādhanarūpasya nānumānasya dūṣaṇam /
analyzed: dūra ūrdhva gamane duḥkham iti sādhya anugaḥ na saḥ  pratisādhana rūpasya na anumānasya dūṣaṇam
translated: then that does not follow the conclusion that going far upwards is painful.

analyzed: upādhiḥ pratirūpam hi sādhanam tat na ca aparam
translated: The qualification is not a fault of inference, which has the form of a counter-argument. For the qualification is a counter-argument, and that is not another.

original: athāpi saśarīratvaṃ cātropādhirna vai bhavet /🔽gatitvaṃ yatra dehitvamiti yat sādhanānugam // / / //
analyzed: athā api sa śarīra tvam ca atrā upādhiḥ na vai bhavet  gati tvam yatra dehi tvam iti yat sādhana anugam
translated: Even if having a body would not be a qualification here,🔽then that which follows the argument, where there is embodiment, is the upward movement.

analyzed: āgama ananusāri tve prasaṅgaḥ yam yatas tatas
translated: This is because this consequence arises from not following the scriptures.

original: nāpasiddhāntatā doṣaḥ prasaṅge yadi sā bhavet /
analyzed: na apasiddhānta tā doṣaḥ prasaṅge yadi sā bhavet
translated: If a consequence were a fault, it would not be the fault of contradicting one's own doctrine.

analyzed: tadā eva atiprasaṅgaḥ syāt na kvacid bhavet
translated: Then there would be an over-extension, and there would be no over-extension anywhere.

analyzed: loka ākāśa gati tvam ced upādhiḥ sādhana anugaḥ
translated: If the upādhi is the state of being in the space of the world, it follows the proof.

original: so 'pītyukte vadet kiṃ sa tasmād vedodito bhavet // / / //
analyzed: saḥ pi iti ukte vadet kim sa tasmāt veda uditaḥ bhavet
translated: When it is said that it is also, he would say: What is that which would be stated in the Veda?

analyzed: mokṣaḥ evam svayam viṣṇuḥ yadi api īśaḥ hi aśeṣa vid
translated: Even though Viṣṇu himself is the Lord and knows everything, if liberation is like this,

analyzed: cakāra saugata matam mohāya eva cakāra yat
translated: He composed the Sāṃkhya system for the sake of delusion, which He composed.

analyzed: asurāṇām ayogyānām veda mārge pravartatām
translated: For the demons who are unfit, who are engaged in the path of the Vedas,

analyzed: atas surā adhikāra tvāt na grāhyam tat matam kvacid
translated: Therefore, because it is for the authority of the demons, that doctrine should not be accepted anywhere.

analyzed: catuṣprakāram tat ca uktam śūnyam vijñānam ekalam
translated: And that is said to be of four kinds: Void, Consciousness alone,

analyzed: anumeya bahis tattvam tathā pratyakṣa bāhya gam
translated: The reality that is to be inferred as external, and likewise the external that is directly perceived.

original: iti tatra tu ye śūnyaṃ vadantyajñānamohitaḥ /
analyzed: iti tatra tu ye śūnyam vadanti ajñāna mohitaḥ
translated: But those who there speak of the Void, deluded by ignorance,

original: te mokṣaṃ tādṛśaṃ brūyurniśśaṅkaṃ māyino yathā // / / //🔽na kiñcinamuktayavasthāyāmātmātmīyamathāpi vā /
analyzed: te mokṣam tādṛśam brūyuḥ niśśaṅkam māyinaḥ yathā  ātma ātmīyam atha api vā
translated: They would speak of liberation in that way, without doubt, like the magicians.🔽In the state of non-abiding, there is neither the self nor what belongs to the self, nor anything else.

analyzed: ekasmin saṃsṛteḥ mukte na kiñcid avaśiṣyate
translated: When one is liberated from saṃsāra, nothing remains.

analyzed: tat saṃvṛtya eva bhedaḥ yam cetana acetana ātmakaḥ
translated: This distinction between the conscious and the unconscious is due to that concealment alone.

analyzed: dṛśyate saṃvṛteḥ dhvaṃse nirviśeṣā eva śūnyatā
translated: When the obscuration is destroyed, emptiness is seen to be without distinction.

original: na sattvaṃ naiva cāsattvaṃ śūnyatattvasya vidyate /
analyzed: na sattvam nā eva ca asattvam śūnya tattvasya vidyate
translated: The reality of emptiness does not exist as either existent or non-existent.

original: na sukhatvaṃ na duḥkhatvaṃ na viśeṣo 'pi kaścana // / / //🔽nirviśeṣaṃ syayambhātaṃ nirlepamajarāmaram /
analyzed: na sukha tvam na duḥkha tvam na viśeṣaḥ u pi kaścana  nirviśeṣam nirlepam ajara amaram
translated: It has no happiness, no suffering, and no distinction whatsoever.🔽This emptiness is self-luminous, without stain, without old age or death,

analyzed: śūnyam tattvam asambādham nānā saṃvṛti varjitam
translated: without distinction, unobstructed, free from various obscurations.

analyzed: aśeṣa doṣa rahitam manaḥ vācām agocaram
translated: Free from all faults, beyond the scope of mind and speech,

analyzed: mokṣaḥ iti ucyate sadbhiḥ nānā saṃvṛti dūṣitam
translated: is called liberation by the wise, tainted by various obscurations.

analyzed: saṃsṛti avastham vijñeyam saṃvṛtyā eva viśeṣyate
translated: The state of samsara should be known to be distinguished only by obscuration,

analyzed: sthitayā dhvastayā ca eva saṃsṛtiḥ mokṣaḥ iti api
translated: by its presence and by its destruction, samsara and liberation.

analyzed: kecid teṣu anyathā prāhuḥ saṃvṛtya eva tu anekadhā
translated: Some speak of them otherwise, but only in many ways by obscuration,

analyzed: avacchinnam mahāśūnyam nānā na pudgala śabditam
translated: the great emptiness delimited, called by various names of non-persons.

analyzed: yasya śūnya eka rasa tā jñānāt sā tu apagacchati
translated: For one whose [obscuration] is removed by the knowledge of the single taste of emptiness,

analyzed: sa pudgala tva nirmuktaḥ mahāśūnyatvam eṣyati
translated: he will be freed from the state of being a person and attain the state of great emptiness.

analyzed: saṃvṛtya anyaḥ tu avacchinnaḥ duḥkhāni anubhavati alam
translated: But delimited by obscuration, he experiences much suffering.

analyzed: iti evam māyinaḥ ca āhuḥ eka jīva tva vādinaḥ
translated: Thus, those who propound the doctrine of one individual soul speak of māyā in this way.

analyzed: bahu jīva matāḥ ca iti māyā teṣām tu saṃvṛtiḥ
translated: And those who hold the doctrine of many individual souls, māyā is their convention.

analyzed: nirviśeṣa tva vācā eva śūnyam brahma eva naḥ bhidā
translated: By the statement of non-distinction, Brahman alone is void, not difference.

analyzed: saccit sukha ādikam ca eva kim kutas khaṇḍa vādinaḥ
translated: And what is existence, consciousness, bliss, etc.? How can there be the doctrine of oneness?

analyzed: vyāvartya mātra bhedaḥ tu vidyate śūnyavādinaḥ
translated: But there is only the difference of what is to be excluded for the proponents of voidness.

analyzed: anṛta ādeḥ apoham tu svayam eva hi manyate
translated: But he himself considers the exclusion of untruth, etc.

analyzed: nirviśeṣa tvataḥ nā eva viśeṣaḥ brahma śūnyayoḥ
translated: Due to the absence of distinction, there is no difference between Brahman and void.

original: prāmāṇyādi ca vedasya phalataḥ samameva hi /🔽atattvāvedakaṃ yasmāt pramāṇaṃ tena kathyate /
analyzed: prāmāṇya ādi ca vedasya phalataḥ samam eva hi  a tattva āvedakam yasmāt pramāṇam tena kathyate
translated: And the authoritativeness of the Veda is indeed the same in terms of the result.🔽Because it is said to be a means of valid knowledge that does not convey reality.

original: atattvāvedakatvaṃ yadaprāmāṇyaṃ satāṃ matam // / / //🔽dīrghabhrāntikarī cet syādatattvāvedakapramā /
analyzed: atattva āvedaka tvam yat aprāmāṇyam satām matam  dīrgha bhrānti karī ced syāt a tattva āvedaka pramā
translated: The non-conveyance of reality is considered by the wise to be the lack of authoritativeness.🔽If the cognition that does not convey reality were to cause long delusion,

analyzed: rajju sarpa ādi vijñānāt api ādhikyāt amāna tā
translated: it would be more despised than even the cognition of a snake in a rope, due to its greater extent.

analyzed: syāt āgamasya a nivartya mahā moha prada tvataḥ  tala nailya ādi vijñānam ākāśe māna tām vrajet
translated: It would be due to the Veda's bestowal of a great delusion that cannot be averted.🔽The cognition of the roughness of the palm would attain authoritativeness in space.

analyzed: chatra ākāra tva vijñānam candra prādeśa tā matiḥ
translated: And the cognition of the circular shape of the moon would be the cognition of its size.

analyzed: nirbheda tvam tu śūnyasya tena api aṅgīkṛtam sadā
translated: But the non-difference of the Void is always accepted by them.

analyzed: sattva asattva ādi dharmāṇām abhāvaḥ ubhayoḥ mataḥ
translated: The absence of the qualities of existence, non-existence, etc. is accepted by both.

original: na hi satpratiyogitvaṃ śūnyatvaṃ tena ceṣyate /
analyzed: na hi sat pratiyogi tvam śūnyatvam tena ca iṣyate
translated: For, the Void is not accepted as having an existent counter-correlate.

analyzed: na ca duḥkha virodhi tvāt anyā hi ānanda tā iṣyate
translated: And bliss is not accepted as anything other than the opposite of suffering.

analyzed: māyinā śūnya pakṣe jñānam jāḍya virodhi ca
translated: Even in the doctrine of the Void, the Mādhyamika accepts knowledge as the opposite of dullness.

analyzed: dharmaḥ te na santi eva kaḥ viśeṣaḥ tatas tayoḥ
translated: Those qualities do not exist for them either. What is the difference between them then?

original: etādṛśānāṃ pakṣāṇāṃ dūṣaṇaṃ prabhurā kṛtam /🔽svapakṣasādanenaiva nābhāva iti coktitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: etādṛśānām pakṣāṇām dūṣaṇam prabhurā kṛtam  sva pakṣa sādanena eva na abhāvaḥ iti ca uktitaḥ
translated: The Lord has refuted such doctrines.🔽By establishing His own doctrine, and by the statement It is not non-existence.

analyzed: ātma abhāve pumarthaḥ kaḥ iṣṭasya ātma avadhiḥ yatas
translated: If there is no self, what is the human goal? Since the self is the limit of what is desired.

analyzed: yadi na ātma avadhiḥ mokṣaḥ mokṣaḥ syāt ghaṭa śūnyatā
translated: If liberation is not limited by the self, liberation would be the emptiness of a pot.

original: kalpitatvād viśeṣāṇāṃ māyino 'pi samaṃ hi tat // / / //
analyzed: kalpita tvāt viśeṣāṇām samam hi tat
translated: Because of the imagined nature of distinctions, that is the same for the Mādhyamika too.

analyzed: dṛśyamāne viśeṣe yadi ced aviśeṣa tā
translated: If there is no distinction even when a distinction is seen,

analyzed: ghaṭa abhāvaḥ viśeṣaḥ syāt pāścātyaḥ ced anāgataḥ
translated: the absence of a pot would be a non-distinction. If it is argued that the future is not present,

analyzed: na mokṣaḥ vimataḥ yasmāt adehaḥ ghaṭa śūnyatā
translated: liberation is not disputed, because the absence of a body is the emptiness of a pot.

analyzed: yathā iti ukte vadet kim sa yaḥ nu mā mātra mānakaḥ
translated: If asked how?, he would say what? He who accepts only inference as valid cognition.

original: na ca māyī vadet tatra pūrvoktenaiva vartmanā /🔽amānatvācchrutestasya nacādehatvavādinī // / / //
analyzed: na ca māyī vadet tatra pūrva uktena eva vartmanā  amāna tvāt śruteḥ tasya na ca adeha tva vādinī
translated: And the Mãyâvâdin would not say there by the very path stated before.🔽Because of the non-authoritativeness of the Veda, and because there is no Vedic text declaring the absence of body,

analyzed: śrutiḥ kācid adeha tvam aprākṛta śarīra gā
translated: There is no Vedic text declaring the absence of body, which is in the non-natural body.

original: mokṣe bhogaṃ yato brūte jakṣan krīḍanniti śrutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: mokṣe bhogam yatas brūte jakṣan krīḍan iti śrutiḥ
translated: Because the Vedic text eating, playing declares enjoyment in liberation.

analyzed: nirduḥkha tvāt na tat mokṣaḥ pratipannam yathā iti ca
translated: Because of the absence of misery, that is not liberation, as it is accepted, and so on.

original: anumādūṣaṇaṃ kiṃ syād vādinoḥ śūnyamāyinoḥ // / / //🔽duḥkhaṃ duḥkhādabhinnatvānmokṣo 'pi syādasaṃśayam /
analyzed: anumā dūṣaṇam kim syāt vādinoḥ śūnya māyinoḥ  duḥkham duḥkhāt abhinna tvāt syāt asaṃśayam
translated: What would be the refutation of inference in the case of the disputants who are void and Mãyâvâdins?🔽Misery would certainly be liberation, because of non-difference from misery.

analyzed: bhede sat vaita tā eva syāt ityādi amita doṣataḥ
translated: If there is difference, there would be dualism, and so on, due to the fault of the infinite regress.

analyzed: heyam māyā matena eva saha śūnya matam budhaiḥ
translated: The doctrine of void and the doctrine of Mâyâ should be abandoned by the wise.

analyzed: evam vijñāna vādaḥ pi jñāna mātra viśeṣataḥ
translated: Thus, the doctrine of Vijñâna also, due to the difference in the nature of knowledge alone,

analyzed: tasya api bhaṅgura tva ādi viśeṣam apahāya hi
translated: Even that has the fault of being perishable, and so on, leaving aside the difference.

analyzed: advaita tā matam sākṣāt ukta doṣaḥ tatas bhavet
translated: The doctrine of non-duality would be directly stated as a fault.

analyzed: kālaḥ na kevala jñānī kāla tvāt pratipanna vat
translated: Time is not a mere knower, because of being time, like what is accepted.

analyzed: etayā anumayā rodhāt na tādṛś mokṣa rūpa tā
translated: By this inference, liberation is not of that kind due to obstruction.

original: yadi kālo 'pi netyāha kadeti praśna uttaram /
analyzed: yadi na iti āha kadā iti praśnaḥ uttaram
translated: If time is also denied, what is the answer to the question when?

original: kiṃ vakṣyati yadāvasthāṃ vadet sā pakṣatāṃ vrajet // / / //
analyzed: kim vakṣyati yadā avasthām vadet sā pakṣatām vrajet
translated: What will be said? When a state is mentioned, it would become the thesis.

original: avasthātvāditi hyeva hetuḥ sāpi kadeti ca /
analyzed: avasthā tvāt iti hi eva hetuḥ sā api kadā iti ca
translated: Because of being a state, this is indeed the reason. That too is asked when?

original: pṛṣṭe kālaśca vaktavyo nākālatvaṃ tato bhavet // / / //
analyzed: pṛṣṭe kālaḥ ca vaktavyaḥ na akāla tvam tatas bhavet
translated: When asked, time must be stated. Then non-time would not be.

analyzed: na kālaḥ iti sāmānya niṣedhe kāla ga pramā
translated: When the general denial not time is made, the cognition of time is obstructed.

analyzed: niruṇaddhi vaktavyaḥ na akāla tvam tatas bhavet
translated: It must be stated. Then non-time would not be.

analyzed: eka jīva tva pakṣe tu kāla abhāvāt iyam pramā
translated: But in the view of one life, due to the absence of time, this cognition

analyzed: kupitā kālam ādāya dvaitam eva upapādayet
translated: would be angry, taking time, and establish duality itself.

analyzed: vimataḥ prapañcavān kālaḥ kāla tvāt pratipanna vat
translated: The disputed world is with time, because of being time, like what is accepted.

analyzed: iti ca anya anumā ekatvam jīvasya vinivārayet
translated: Thus another inference would prevent the oneness of the individual soul.

analyzed: kāla śabda īśvara eka tva matāni api evam eva hi
translated: The oneness of time, word, and God are also like this indeed.

analyzed: nirākṛtāni teṣām ca sama tvāt pakṣa doṣayoḥ
translated: They are also refuted, because of the equality of the faults of their positions.

analyzed: jñānam sva rasa bhaṅgayā iva nitya santām iṣyate
translated: Knowledge is accepted as having a permanent continuum, like a river, which is naturally interrupted.

analyzed: bauddhābhyām aparābhyām tu tatra api uktā anumā ripuḥ
translated: But by the other two Buddhists, the opponent's inference is stated there also.

analyzed: mokṣaḥ na śuddhavijñāna santānī kālaga tvataḥ
translated: Liberation is not the continuum of pure consciousness, due to the passage of time.

analyzed: pratipannaḥ yathā iti etat anumānam tat uttaram
translated: This inference is the reply to that, that it is as if one has set out.

analyzed: anumānāni sarvāṇi pratisādhana yogataḥ
translated: All inferences are refuted by the application of counter-arguments.

analyzed: niṣiddhāni ukta bhaṅgayā eva śrutayaḥ ca asmad ukti gāḥ
translated: And the scriptures are refuted by the same reasoning that has been stated, and are in agreement with our statements.

analyzed: sāṅkhaya naiyāyika ādyāḥ ca prāhuḥ mokṣam tu nissukham
translated: The Sankhyas, Naiyayikas and others say that liberation is devoid of happiness,

analyzed: icchā dveṣa prayatna ādeḥ api sarva ātmanā layam
translated: And the dissolution of desire, aversion, effort and so on in every way.

analyzed: tatra āhuḥ na etat api atra śobhanam śrutayaḥ yatas
translated: To that, they say that this is not beautiful here, because the scriptures

original: mahānandaṃ ca bhogaṃ ca niyamena vadanti hi // / / //
analyzed: mahā ānandam ca bhogam ca niyamena vadanti hi
translated: Indeed invariably speak of great bliss and enjoyment.

analyzed: prākṛta priya hāniḥ tu priyā spṛṣṭiḥ iti īryate
translated: The loss of natural pleasure is called the absence of contact with pleasure.

analyzed: apriyam pratikūlam tad aviśeṣeṇa śabditam
translated: Unpleasantness is said to be unfavorable without distinction.

original: nāsti hyaprākṛtaṃ duḥkhaṃ sato jīvasya kutracit /🔽priyaṃ svarūpamevāsya balānandādivākyataḥ // / / //
analyzed: na asti hi aprākṛtam duḥkham sataḥ jīvasya kutracid  priyam sva rūpam eva asya bala ānanda ādi vākyataḥ
translated: For the existent soul of a living being, there is no natural unhappiness anywhere.🔽Pleasure is indeed its own nature, according to the statements about strength, bliss and so on.

analyzed: heya tvāt apapriyasya eva priya hāneḥ aniṣṭhataḥ
translated: Because of the undesirability of unhappiness itself, due to the non-finality of the loss of pleasure,

original: na samastapriyābhāvo mokṣe prokte tu yujyate // / / //
analyzed: na samasta priya abhāvaḥ mokṣe prokte tu yujyate
translated: Nor is the absence of all that is dear proper in the case of Liberation which has been described as being of the nature of Brahman.

analyzed: apriyasya sva rūpa tvam asureṣu eva hi śrutam
translated: The nature of what is not dear has been heard of only among the Asuras.

analyzed: asurāḥ na evam evam ca na evam ca akhila mānuṣāḥ
translated: The Asuras are not so, and all men are not so.

analyzed: iti ātma priya hānāya kaḥ yateta ca buddhimān
translated: What wise man would strive to abandon what is dear to the self for this (i.e. for the sake of Liberation)?

analyzed: sañjñā nā asti iti api hi asya na amukta jñeya tā iti hi
translated: Even the absence of the designation (of Brahman) is not proper, because it is not to be known by one who is not liberated.

analyzed: dharma anucchittim eva asya yatas vaktī uttara śrutiḥ
translated: The later Vedic text has stated the non-destruction of its (Brahman's) attributes, because of the doubt of the destruction of its knowledge.

analyzed: āśaṅkayā asya jñāna hānim maitreyyāḥ moham āha mām
translated: Maitreyi said to me, I am deluded, because of the doubt of the destruction of its knowledge.

original: bhavānityuktavatyā hi nāhaṃ mohaṃ vadāmi te /
analyzed: bhavān iti uktavatyā hi na aham moham vadāmi te
translated: I do not say you are deluded, said she who was addressed as you by him.

analyzed: iti uktavā yājñavalkyaḥ hi sva rūpa anāśam ūcivān
translated: Having said this, Yajnavalkya indeed spoke of the non-destruction of its nature.

original: jñānarūpasya vijñānānāśastannāśa eva yat /🔽iti śūnyamatocchittyai punarānandapūrvakān /
analyzed: jñāna rūpasya vijñāna anāśaḥ tad nāśaḥ eva yat  iti śūnya mata ucchittyai punar ānanda pūrvakān
translated: The non-destruction of the knowledge of one whose nature is knowledge is indeed the non-destruction of that (knowledge).🔽Thus, in order to remove the doctrine of emptiness, he again stated the attributes beginning with bliss,

analyzed: dharmān āha api anucchinnān tārkikaiḥ vinivāritān
translated: which were refuted by the logicians as being not destroyed.

analyzed: mātrā saṃsargam api āha tathā mādhyandina śrutiḥ
translated: The Madhyandina Srauta Sutra also speaks of the contact with the measure (of bliss).

original: ācikṣepa mataṃ tacca yasmin na viṣayādanam /
analyzed: ācikṣepa matam tat ca yasmin na viṣaya adanam
translated: And that doctrine was refuted by him in which there is no enjoyment of objects.

analyzed: ghrāṇa ādi bhoga abhāvasya tu aniṣṭa tva hṛdā śrutiḥ
translated: The Vedic text, however, is intended to convey the undesirable fact of the absence of enjoyment through the nose etc.

analyzed: yena idam akhilam veda vijñātāram svam eva ca
translated: By whom this entire universe is known, and also one's own self,

original: kena taṃ ca vijānīyādityaniṣṭaṃ hi sarvathā // / / //
analyzed: kena tam ca vijānīyāt iti aniṣṭam hi sarvathā
translated: and by whom that (Lord) should be known - this is indeed undesirable in every way.

analyzed: na akhila jñāpakaḥ viṣṇuḥ ajñeyaḥ niyamena hi
translated: Vishnu, who is the revealer of all, is certainly not to be known.

analyzed: tad jñāna artham hi vedānām akhilānām pravartanam  pratyakṣa āgama ātma vijñāna avirodha anubhavāt api
translated: The functioning of all the Vedas is for the purpose of knowing Him.🔽Even due to the non-contradictory experience of the knowledge of the self through perception and scripture,

analyzed: na sva vijñāni tāyām ca virodhaḥ kaścana iyate
translated: there is no contradiction at all in the knowability of the self.

analyzed: kartṛ karma virodhaḥ ca nitya anubhava virodhataḥ
translated: And the contradiction between the agent and the object is due to the contradiction with the eternal experience.

analyzed: katham eva padam gacchet virodhaḥ dṛṣṭa bādhanam
translated: How can the contradiction, which contradicts what is seen, ever occur?

analyzed: sā u śnute sarva kāman ca kāmānnī kāmarūpī atha
translated: He enjoys all desires, desires, and the form of desire.

original: ityādiśrutayaścoktamarthameva vadanti hi // / / //🔽asvātantryādivetyuktaṃ na dvaitābhāvataḥ kvacit /🔽ātmaivābhūditi hyasmādaviśeṣaprasaṅgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: ityādi śrutayaḥ ca uktam artham eva vadanti hi  asvātantryāt iva iti uktam na dvaita abhāvataḥ kvacid  ātmā eva abhūt iti hi asmāt aviśeṣa prasaṅgataḥ
translated: Thus, the scriptures also state the same meaning.🔽It is said that it is not due to the absence of dependence etc., but due to the non-existence of duality anywhere.🔽Because of the statement the Self alone existed, there is the undesirable consequence of non-distinction.

analyzed: asvātantrya upamā bheda bhedeṣu iva udīritaḥ
translated: As if in the differences of dependence etc., it is said.

original: śabdatattva iti proktaṃ maitreyyuktottaraṃ ca kim // / / //
analyzed: śabda tattve iti proktam maitreyī ukta uttaram ca kim
translated: The truth of sound is said to be so. What is said by Maitreyi?

original: sukhādidharmahānau tu mukteḥ kiñca prayojanam /🔽yadyartho duḥkhahāniḥ syādanarthaḥ sukhanāśanam // / / //
analyzed: sukha ādi dharma hānau tu mukteḥ kiñca prayojanam  yadi arthaḥ duḥkha hāniḥ syāt anarthaḥ sukha nāśanam
translated: But in the loss of happiness and other qualities, what is the purpose of liberation?🔽If the purpose is the destruction of suffering, and the non-purpose is the destruction of happiness,

analyzed: tayoḥ ca duḥkha hānāt hi sukha nāśaḥ dhikaḥ bhavet
translated: and the destruction of happiness would be greater than the destruction of suffering,

analyzed: prāpya api duḥkham su mahat sukha leśa āptaye janaḥ
translated: even having attained great suffering, a person strives for the attainment of a small amount of happiness.

original: yatate sukhahānau hi ko mokṣāya yatet pumān // / / //
analyzed: yatate sukha hānau hi kaḥ mokṣāya yatet pumān
translated: Who would strive for liberation in the destruction of happiness?

analyzed: alpāt ca sukha anāśāt hi bibheti atitarām janaḥ
translated: And people are very afraid of the destruction of a small amount of happiness,

analyzed: mahat ca duḥkham āpnoti sukha nāśa nivṛttaye
translated: and they attain great suffering for the sake of preventing the destruction of happiness.

original: na ca rāganimittaṃ tad vītarāgā api sphuṭam /
analyzed: na ca rāga nimittam tat vīta rāgāḥ api sphuṭam
translated: And that is not for the sake of passion, for those free from passion clearly

analyzed: nārada ādyāḥ sukha arthāya sahante duḥkham añjasā
translated: Narada and others, for the sake of happiness, endure suffering with ease.

analyzed: yuddha ādi darśanam yasmāt su duḥkhena api
translated: Because they engage in watching battles and so on even with great difficulty.

analyzed: yadā indra vairocanayoḥ brahmāstrābhyām su tāpitāḥ
translated: When Indra and Virochana were greatly tormented by Brahma's weapons,

analyzed: api nā evā ājahuḥ yuddha rasāt te nārada ādayaḥ
translated: Narada and others did not abandon their enthusiasm for battle.

analyzed: iti skānda vacaḥ tasmāt sukha abhāvasya kaḥ yatet
translated: Thus, according to the Skanda Purana, who would strive for the absence of happiness?

analyzed: vimataḥ duḥkha yuj yasmāt cetanaḥ san sukha ujkhitaḥ
translated: The opponent is miserable because he is endowed with misery, being conscious and devoid of happiness,

analyzed: pratipannaḥ yathā iti eva ca anumā kena vāryate
translated: just as it is accepted. By whom is inference thus prevented?

analyzed: sarva śruti purāṇeṣu sukha bhāva uktitaḥ tathā
translated: And because the state of happiness is spoken of in all the Vedas and Puranas,

analyzed: muktau na grāhyam eva etat sukha abhāva matam budhaiḥ
translated: the wise should not accept this view of the absence of happiness in liberation at all.

analyzed: saḥ na ānandāt vimuktaḥ san ānandī bhavati sphuṭam
translated: Having become liberated from that which is not bliss, he clearly becomes blissful.

original: nirguṇe brahmaṇi mayi dhārayan viśadaṃ manaḥ /
analyzed: nirguṇe brahmaṇi mayi dhārayan viśadam manaḥ
translated: Fixing his clear mind on me, the Brahman devoid of qualities,

analyzed: parama ānandam āpnoti yatra kāmaḥ vasīyate
translated: he attains the highest bliss, where desire is fulfilled.

original: na viṣṇusadṛśaṃ daivaṃ na mokṣasadṛśaṃ sukham /
analyzed: na viṣṇu sadṛśam daivam na mokṣa sadṛśam sukham
translated: There is no god equal to Vishnu, no happiness equal to liberation,

analyzed: na veda sadṛśam vākyam na kāra sammitaḥ
translated: no statement equal to the Vedas, no syllable equal to the syllable A.

analyzed: yatra ānandāḥ ca modāḥ ca mudaḥ pramudaḥ āsate
translated: Where joys, great joys, and delights abide,

analyzed: kāmasya yatra āptāḥ kāmāḥ tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi
translated: where desires are fulfilled, there make me immortal.

analyzed: iti śruti purāṇāni tatra tatra vadanti hi
translated: Thus the Vedas and Puranas declare again and again.

original: ato mokṣe sukhābhāva iti yatkiñcideva hi // / / //
analyzed: atas mokṣe sukha abhāvaḥ iti yat kiñcid eva hi
translated: Therefore, the statement that there is no happiness in liberation is mere conjecture.

analyzed: śiraḥ kara ādi abhāvaḥ ca na muktasya bhavet kvacid
translated: And the absence of head, hands, etc. would never be for one who is liberated.

analyzed: śrutayaḥ ca purāṇāni mānam atra bahūni ca
translated: And the Vedas and Puranas are the many authorities here.

original: na vartate yatra rajastamastayoḥ sattvaṃ ca miśraṃ na ca kālavikramaḥ /
analyzed: na vartate yatra rajaḥ tamaḥ tayoḥ sattvam ca miśram na ca kāla vikramaḥ
translated: Where there is no rajas or tamas, nor sattva mixed with them, nor the influence of time,

original: na yatra māyā kimutāpare hareranuvratā yatra surāsurārcitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na yatra māyā kim uta apare hareḥ anuvratāḥ yatra sura asura arcitāḥ
translated: Where there is no maya, nor others devoted to Hari, worshipped by gods and demons.

analyzed: śyāma avadātāḥ śatapatra locanāḥ piśaṅga vastrāḥ su rucaḥ supeśasaḥ
translated: Dark and fair, with eyes like hundred-petalled lotuses, wearing yellow garments, very beautiful, well-formed,

analyzed: sarve catur bāhavaḥ unmiṣat maṇi praveka niṣka ābharaṇāḥ su varcasaḥ
translated: All with four arms, adorned with prominent jewels, gold necklaces, and brilliant ornaments.

analyzed: pravāḷa vaiḍūrya mṛṇāḷa varcasām parisphurat kuṇḍala mauli mālinām
translated: Surrounded by the splendor of coral, lapis lazuli, and emerald, adorned with shining earrings, crowns, and garlands,

analyzed: bhrājiṣṇubhiḥ yaḥ paritas virājate lasat vimāna āvalibhiḥ mahātmanām
translated: It shines all around with the sparkling rows of celestial vehicles of the great souls.

analyzed: vidyotamāna pramadā uttamābhiḥ sa vidyut abhra āvalibhiḥ yathā nabhaḥ
translated: Like the sky with its rows of clouds shining with lightning,

original: śrīryatra rūpiṇyurugāyapādayoḥ karoti mānaṃ bahudhā vibhūtibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrīḥ yatra rūpiṇī uru gāya pādayoḥ karoti mānam bahudhā vibhūtibhiḥ
translated: Where Shri, in embodied form, at the feet of the great Lord, shows her many powers.

original: ṛcāṃ tvaḥ poṣamāste pupuṣvān gāyatraṃ tvo gāyati śakvarīṣu /
analyzed: ṛcām tvaḥ poṣam āste pupuṣvān gāyatram tvaḥ gāyati śakvarīṣu
translated: You, the nourisher, dwell in the nourishment of the Rig Veda, they sing the Gayatri verses about you in the Shakvari meter,

original: brahmā tvo vadati jātavidyāṃ yajñasya mātraṃ vimibhīta u tvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahmā tvaḥ vadati jāta vidyām yajñasya mātram vimibhīte u tvaḥ
translated: Brahmā speaks to you the knowledge of birth, and you have measured the extent of the sacrifice.

analyzed: kāma anna rūpī carati iti pūrva śrutyā purāṇa uktibhiḥ api adoṣaḥ
translated: There is no fault even by the statement of the Purāṇas that he moves in the form of desire, as heard before.

original: dehaḥ svarūpātmaka eva teṣāṃ muktiṃ gatānāmapi ceyate hi // / / //
analyzed: dehaḥ sva rūpa ātmakaḥ eva teṣām muktim gatānām api ca iyate hi
translated: For them, the body is indeed of the nature of the Self even after attaining liberation.

original: śiraḥkarādyairapi muktibhājo yuktā yataste puruṣā idānīm /
analyzed: śiraḥ kara ādyaiḥ api mukti bhājaḥ yuktāḥ yatas te puruṣāḥ idānīm
translated: For they are now endowed with heads, hands, etc., since they are men who have attained liberation.

analyzed: yathā iti pūrvāḥ anumāḥ ca jīva sva rūpam aṅga ādi yugāpayanti
translated: The inferences based on the statement as before also establish the nature of the individual soul as having limbs, etc.

original: na brahmarūpatvamamuṣya dehino muktāvapi syāt pramayā kathañcit /
analyzed: na brahma rūpa tvam amuṣya dehinaḥ muktau api syāt pramayā kathañcid
translated: The body of this embodied being would not even in liberation become of the nature of Brahman in any way by valid knowledge.

original: sa brahmaṇā sahito 'śeṣabhogān bhuṅkte tathopetya sukhārṇavaṃ tam // / / //🔽yattat paraṃ jyotirupetya jīvo nijasvarapūtvamavāpya kāmān /
analyzed: sa brahmaṇā śeṣa bhogān bhuṅkte tathā upetya sukha arṇavam tam  yat tat param jyotiḥ upetya jīvaḥ nija svara pū tvam avāpya kāmān
translated: He, along with Brahman, enjoys all pleasures, and having approached that ocean of bliss,🔽Having approached that supreme light, the individual soul obtains its own natural state and enjoys desires.

original: bhuṅkte sa daivaṃ puruṣottamo 'ja ātmeti cokto guṇapūrtihetoḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhuṅkte sa daivam puruṣottamaḥ jaḥ ātmā iti ca uktaḥ guṇa pūrti hetoḥ
translated: That unborn supreme being, called the Self for the sake of fulfilling the qualities,

analyzed: setuḥ sa khila mukti bhāgā muta amṛtasya iṣyaḥ iha īśitā yat
translated: That God is the dam, the desired one of the path to complete liberation here, being the controller.

analyzed: ityādi vākyaiḥ bhagavat vaśaḥ san bhuṅkte akhilān mukti gataḥ pi bhogān
translated: Thus, even after attaining liberation, he enjoys all pleasures, being under the control of the Lord.

original: kālo 'pyasau naikyayutaḥ pareṇa jīvasya kālo yata eṣa yadvat /
analyzed: pi asau na aikya yutaḥ pareṇa jīvasya kālaḥ yatas eṣa yadvat
translated: Even that time is not one with the Supreme, since this time of the individual soul is as follows.

original: ityādikā apyanumāḥ pramāṇaṃ muktau ca jīvasya paratvarodhe // / / //
analyzed: iti ādikāḥ api anumāḥ pramāṇam muktau ca jīvasya paratva rodhe
translated: Such inferences are also valid in the restriction of the individual soul to the Supreme in liberation.

original: kathaṃ ca yaḥ pūrvamasau na paścād bhavet sa evetyapi yuktimeti /
analyzed: katham ca yaḥ pūrvam asau na paścāt bhavet saḥ evā iti api yuktim eti
translated: And how can it be logically possible that he who was not before would be the same later?

original: yato na dṛṣṭaṃ yadabhūnna pūrvaṃ paścāt tadāseti kutaśca kiñcit // / / //
analyzed: yatas na dṛṣṭam yat abhūt na pūrvam paścāt tat āsa iti kutas ca kiñcid
translated: Because nothing is seen that was not before and then comes later.

original: nacaiva muktau tu hareḥ pṛthaktavamaikyaṃ tathā syāditi yuktimeti /
analyzed: na ca eva muktau tu hareḥ pṛthak tavam aikyam tathā syāt iti yuktim eti
translated: And the difference of the individual soul from Hari in liberation does not logically follow, as there would be oneness.

original: yato na kutrāpi bhidābhidā ca dṛṣṭā citaścetanayā kutaścit // / / //
analyzed: yatas na kutra api bhidā abhidā ca dṛṣṭā citaḥ cetanayā kutaścid
translated: Because nowhere is difference or non-difference of the conscious from the intellect seen for any reason.

original: itthaṃ matāni bhramajāni yasmānmokṣaṃ samuddeśyamapi bhrameṇa /
analyzed: ittham matāni bhrama jāni yasmāt mokṣam samuddeśyam api bhrameṇa
translated: Thus, the views that are born of delusion, even regarding liberation as the goal,

original: vidurna samyag yadapīha laukikāḥ sukhaṃ mama syācca sadeti jānate // / / //
analyzed: viduḥ na samyak yat api iha laukikāḥ sukham mama syāt ca sadā iti jānate
translated: The worldly people do not know correctly, though they know that good may happen to me.

analyzed: audāryam uccāvaca śaktiḥ ātma svara pū dārḍhyam ca nija svabhāvaḥ
translated: Magnanimity, high and low power, and firmness of one's own nature,

analyzed: svātantryam āpūrṇa viśeṣa yogya tā virodha hāniḥ ca caturtha pāde
translated: Independence, complete fitness for particulars, and removal of contradiction, are in the fourth section.

analyzed: vyavasthitiḥ tu aviśeṣaḥ sthitiḥ ca niṣedha sāmānya vidhi kriyāṇām
translated: Establishment, non-distinction, and the prohibition, general rule, and action of existence,

analyzed: vibhakta tā ca atvarayā eva siddhiḥ vipakṣa samprāpti viruddha hetavaḥ
translated: And the distinction is accomplished by the very refutation, the attainment of the opposite, and contradictory reasons.

analyzed: su śakya tā śaśvat ati prasiddhi viveka vinyāsa vicāra sañjñāḥ
translated: Great possibility, always very well known, arrangement of discrimination, and investigation, are the names.

analyzed: nānā pravṛttiḥ kṛtakṛtya tā ca vipakṣa tarkāḥ samatīta pāde
translated: Various activities, and the state of having accomplished one's purpose, are the arguments against the opposite, in the past section.

original: mahāphalatvaṃ praviviktatā ca sandhigrahaḥ sādhanamāptakṛtyam /🔽viśeṣakāryaṃ kṛtisaṃsthitiśca suyuktayo nirṇayagāḥ svapakṣe // / / //
analyzed: mahā phala tvam pravivikta tā ca sandhi grahaḥ sādhanam āpta kṛtyam  viśeṣa kāryam kṛti saṃsthitiḥ ca su yuktayaḥ nirṇaya gāḥ sva pakṣe
translated: Great fruitfulness, and seclusion, grasping the connection, the means, and the accomplished duty,🔽The special work, and the establishment of action, are the well-reasoned conclusions leading to the decision in one's own case.

analyzed: vyāmiśra tā kārya kara tvam artha kḷptiḥ su dārḍhyam paratantra tā ca
translated: Mixture, causing the effect, the arrangement of the meaning, great firmness, and dependence on another,

analyzed: samāna dharmaḥ kṛta śeṣa tā ca lokopamā pūrva mata anusārāḥ
translated: The common property, and the remainder of what is done, are the worldly analogies, following the former opinion.

analyzed: viśeṣa sāmya śrutiḥ āḍhya tā ca samāna lopaḥ mahimā viśeṣaḥ
translated: The similarity of the distinction, and the abundance, the equal omission, the greatness, the distinction,

analyzed: kṛtārtha tā śaśvat anupravṛttiḥ siddhānta nirṇīti viśiṣṭa hetavaḥ
translated: The accomplished purpose, and the constant continuation, are the distinguished reasons for the final decision.

analyzed: pradhāna vāyuḥ tu iha vāyu nāmā yuktayā
translated: The chief wind is called Vayu here, and is said to be present in the elements, but in a proper way.

original: yasmācchrutau pavate ceti bhūri prokto yato bhūtamānī ca so 'pi /
analyzed: yasmāt śrutau pavate ca iti bhūri proktaḥ yatas bhūta mānī ca saḥ
translated: Because in the Vedas it is said to blow abundantly, and because it is also called the controller of the elements.

original: mahāmānī tvalpamānī ca yasmāt tacchabdenāpyucyate tena so 'pi // / / //
analyzed: mahā mānī tu alpa mānī ca yasmāt tad śabdena api ucyate tena
translated: Because it is the great controller and the lesser controller, it is also called by that word, therefore it is also so.

original: tasmin layaṃ yānti bhūtānyaśeṣakramāvirodhena sa eva viṣṇau /
analyzed: tasmin layam yānti bhūtāni aśeṣa krama avirodhena saḥ eva viṣṇau
translated: In it, all the elements merge in due order, and it itself merges in Vishnu.

original: indrādīnāṃ tatra layaḥ kramaṃ tu proktaṃ viśeṣādanusṛtya nānyat // / / //
analyzed: indra ādīnām tatra layaḥ kramam tu proktam viśeṣāt anusṛtya na anyat
translated: The merging of Indra and others there is stated in due order, but not otherwise, following the special order.

original: tasmādaśeṣā girijāṃ praviśya tayaiva rudraṃ saha tena vāṇīm /
analyzed: tasmāt aśeṣāḥ girijām praviśya tayā eva rudram saha tena vāṇīm
translated: Therefore, all the living beings enter Parvati, by her Rudra, with her the goddess of speech,

original: tayā patiṃ prāpya sahaiva tena layaṃ harau yānti samastajīvāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tayā patim prāpya saha eva tena layam harau yānti samasta jīvāḥ
translated: by her the husband, and with him alone they merge in Hari.

original: somastu vārīśayuto 'niruddhaṃ viśatyasau kāmamasau ca vāruṇīm /
analyzed: somaḥ tu vārīśa yutaḥ niruddham viśati asau kāmam asau ca vāruṇīm
translated: The moon, along with Varuna, enters Aniruddha, he Kama, and she Varuni.

original: sā śeṣadevaṃ sa giraṃ ca saiva vāyuṃ viśatyañja itīha nirṇayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sā śeṣa devam sa giram ca sā eva vāyum viśati añjas iti iha nirṇayaḥ
translated: She enters Sesha, the god, and he speech, and she Vayu, Anjana. This is the conclusion here.

original: umāgirīśāvapi bhāratīrāviti sma vāg vedagatā bravīti /
analyzed: umā giri īśau api bhārata irau iti sma vāc veda gatā bravīti
translated: Uma and Girisha also enter Bharati and Ravi, thus speech present in the Vedas says.

analyzed: ahi indra patnīm ahipam viriñca patnīm viriñcam ca vimukti kāle
translated: The wife of the king of serpents, the serpent, the wife of Brahmā, and Brahmā, at the time of liberation,

original: ta eva yat tatpadamāpnuvanti tatkāla etān samupāsya jīvāḥ /
analyzed: te eva yat tat padam āpnuvanti tad kāle etān samupāsya jīvāḥ
translated: Those very ones who attain that state, having worshipped these at that time, the living beings,

original: brahmatvakāle praviśanti caitānīti sma vāk tādṛśatāmupaiti // / / //
analyzed: brahmatva kāle praviśanti ca etāni iti sma vāc tādṛśa tām upaiti
translated: At the time of becoming Brahmā, enter these, thus does speech attain such a state.

original: sūryo 'gniyukto gurumāpya tena śakraṃ sahainena suparṇapatnīm /
analyzed: sūryaḥ gni yuktaḥ gurum āpya tena śakram saha enena suparṇa patnīm
translated: The sun, along with Agni, enters Guru, by that Indra, along with his wife Suparṇa,

original: tayā suparṇaṃ saha tena vāṇīṃ brahmāṇametadgata eva yāti // / / //
analyzed: tayā suparṇam saha tena vāṇīm brahmāṇam etad gataḥ eva yāti
translated: By her Suparṇa, along with him, speech, Brahmā, he enters only that.

analyzed: indra praveśaḥ tu yadā ucyate tadā hi umā iti eva suparṇa patnī
translated: But when the entry of Indra is mentioned here, then the wife of Suparṇa is called Umā,

original: uktā suparṇaśca girīśanāmnā tato virodhaśca na kaścanātra // / / //
analyzed: uktā suparṇaḥ ca girīśa nāmnā tatas virodhaḥ ca na kaścana atra
translated: And Suparṇa is mentioned by the name of Śiva, therefore there is no contradiction here at all.

analyzed: bhṛgu ādayaḥ dakṣam avāpya tena prāpya indram etena suparṇa patnīm
translated: Bhṛgu and others, having attained Dakṣa, by him Indra, by him the wife of Suparṇa,

original: viśanti ye manavo rājamukhyā manuṃ praviśyātra gatā mahendram // / / //
analyzed: viśanti ye manavaḥ rāja mukhyāḥ manum praviśya atra gatāḥ mahā indram
translated: The Manus who enter here, the chief kings, having entered Manu, have gone to Mahendra.

original: ākāśa urvī ca guruṃ praviśya tenaiva yātaḥ puruhūtadevam /
analyzed: ākāśe urvī ca gurum praviśya tena eva yātaḥ puruhūta devam
translated: Space and earth, having entered Guru, by him alone he has gone to the god Puruhuta,

original: sanādayo yatayaḥ kāmameva viśanti śiṣṭā api havyavāham // / / //
analyzed: sana ādayaḥ yatayaḥ kāmam eva viśanti śiṣṭāḥ api havyavāham
translated: The ascetics beginning with Sanaka enter Kāma, the cultured ones even the carrier of oblations.

original: varṇāśramācāraratā manuṣyā dharmaṃ manuṃ so 'pi sameti kāle /
analyzed: varṇa āśrama ācāra ratāḥ manuṣyāḥ dharmam manum saḥ u pi sameti kāle
translated: Men engaged in the duties of their castes and stages of life, in due course, attain Manu, the Dharma king.

original: tameva sarve pitaraḥ surānugāḥ sarve kuberaṃ sa ca somameva // / / //🔽vimuktikāle praviśantyabhīkṣṇaṃ bhogāṃśca taddehagatāḥ prabhuñjate /
analyzed: tam eva sarve pitaraḥ sura anugāḥ sarve kuberam sa ca somam eva  vimukti kāle praviśanti abhīkṣṇam bhogān ca tad deha gatāḥ prabhuñjate
translated: All the ancestors, following the gods, all Kubera, and he Soma himself,🔽At the time of liberation, they frequently enter and enjoy the pleasures present in that body.

analyzed: ānanda su vyaktiḥ amutra teṣām bhavati atas ca iṣyataḥ eva nirgatāḥ
translated: Their bliss becomes very manifest there, and from there they are considered to depart.

original: krīḍanti bhūyaśca samāviśanti tāneva sāyujyamidaṃ vadanti // / / //
analyzed: krīḍanti bhūyas ca samāviśanti tān eva sāyujyam idam vadanti
translated: They play and again enter those very [bodies], this is called saṃyoga.

original: sāyujyahīnāśca laye tu sarve proktena mārgeṇa viśanti sṛṣṭau /
analyzed: sāyujya hīnāḥ ca laye tu sarve proktena mārgeṇa viśanti sṛṣṭau
translated: And in dissolution, all those devoid of saṃyoga enter by the aforementioned path in creation.

original: bahiśca niryānti tato 'nyadāpi sāyujyabhājāṃ bhavati praveśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bahis ca niryānti tatas nyadā api sāyujya bhājām bhavati praveśaḥ
translated: And they also go out from there at another time. The entry of those who attain saṃyoga is [different].

original: uktaṃ samastaṃ paramaśrutau hi proktaṃ tu sargakramato viparyayaḥ /
analyzed: uktam samastam parama śrutau hi proktam tu sarga kramataḥ viparyayaḥ
translated: All this has been stated in the supreme scripture. But the reverse order is stated in the sequence of creation.

original: muktau laye yadvadatho layaśca viparyayeṇetyavadad girāṃ patiḥ // / / //
analyzed: muktau laye yadvat atho layaḥ ca viparyayeṇa iti avadat girām patiḥ
translated: At the time of liberation, in dissolution, and in dissolution, the lord of speech has said that it is the reverse.

original: layo yato muktiriyaṃ surāṇāṃ bhogo viśeṣeṇa ca yaṃ vadiṣyati /
analyzed: layaḥ yatas muktiḥ iyam surāṇām bhogaḥ viśeṣeṇa ca yam vadiṣyati
translated: For the gods, this is liberation, and he will speak of it in particular as enjoyment.

analyzed: uktaḥ ca bimba pratibimba bhāvaḥ piṅga śrutau ukta laya anusārataḥ
translated: And the relation of original and reflection has been stated according to the sequence of dissolution mentioned in the Pingala Sruti.

original: bimbe layo yanniyataśca muktau cidātmanāṃ tadvaśatā ca sarvadā /
analyzed: bimbe layaḥ yat niyataḥ ca muktau cit ātmanām tad vaśa tā ca sarvadā
translated: And the dissolution of the individual souls in the original Brahman, and their subjection to Him always,

original: tejo 'bhidhāṃ tu śriyamāpya viṣṇumagre tataḥ putratayaiva vāyuḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ bhidhām tu śriyam āpya viṣṇum agre tatas putra tayā eva vāyuḥ
translated: Having attained the glory of Vishnu, who is called Tejas, Vayu (the wind-god) becomes his son first,

original: āptaḥ prasūtaḥ punareva viṣṇuṃ praviśya muktaḥ praḷaye 'tra tiṣṭhati // / / //
analyzed: āptaḥ prasūtaḥ punar eva viṣṇum praviśya muktaḥ praḷaye tra tiṣṭhati
translated: and having entered Vishnu again, he is liberated and remains here at the time of dissolution.

analyzed: sarve pi te mukta gaṇāḥ amanda sāndram nija ānandam aśeṣatas
translated: All those liberated souls enjoy their own bliss, which is very intense and complete,

original: bhuñjanta evāsata īśadehe laye 'tha sarge bahireva yānti // / / //
analyzed: bhuñjantaḥ eva asataḥ īśa dehe laye sarge bahis eva yānti
translated: while residing in the body of the Lord. Then at the time of creation, they go out.

original: prayāti dharmaṃ nirṛtistu śakraṃ marudgaṇāḥ pārṣadāstathaiva /
analyzed: prayāti dharmam nirṛtiḥ tu śakram marut gaṇāḥ pārṣadāḥ tathā eva
translated: Nirriti goes to Dharma, the Marut hosts and the attendants to Shakra (Indra),

analyzed: sarve niruddham pṛtanādhipa ādya astuḥ aśrutiḥ hi ittham iyam vimuktiḥ
translated: all to Aniruddha, beginning with the commander of the army. Thus is this liberation heard.

analyzed: iti śrīmat ānandatīrtha bhagavat pāda ācārya viracite śrīmat brahmasūtra anuvyākhyane caturtha adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second chapter of the Anubhasya on the fourth chapter of the Vedanta Sastras composed by the great Acharya Sriman Ananta Tirtha.

original: utkrāntamārgaśca vimuktagamyaṃ pādoditam sukramavikramau ca /🔽sāntānikaṃ prāptirabhīṣyatā ca saukayarmityanyamatasya tarkāḥ // / / //
analyzed: utkrānta mārgaḥ ca vimukta gamyam pāda uditam sukrama vikramau ca  sāntānikam prāptiḥ abhīṣya tā ca saukayarmiti anya matasya tarkāḥ
translated: The path of departure, the attainable by liberation, the foot-originated, the good step, the valorous,🔽The hereditary, the attainment, the desirability, and the easy practice - these are the arguments of the other view.

analyzed: viśeṣa samprāptiḥ uru tvam āptiḥ krama anurāgaḥ kathita anuvṛttiḥ
translated: The attainment of distinction, the state of being loud, the attainment, the conformity with the sequence, the conformity with what is declared,

original: siddhāntanirṇītikarāḥ pratīkaṃ dehādikaṃ tadgatameva ye narāḥ // / / //
analyzed: siddhānta nirṇīti karāḥ pratīkam deha ādikam tad gatam eva ye narāḥ
translated: Those men who consider the symbol, such as the body, etc., to be the same as that [Brahman],

analyzed: upāsate te puratas samāpnuyuḥ brahmāṇam asmāt matim āpya viṣṇum
translated: They who worship will attain Brahman in front, having obtained the mind from this [Brahman], and Vishnu.

original: prāpsyantyato 'nye 'pi tamāpya tasmāddhariṃ gatā muktibhājaḥ parānte // / / //
analyzed: prāpsyanti atas nye tam āpya tasmāt harim gatāḥ mukti bhājaḥ parānte
translated: Others than these will also attain Him from Him, and having gone to Hari, will be partakers of liberation at the end.

analyzed: śrīmat ānandatīrtha bhagavat pāda ācārya viracite śrīmat brahmasūtra anuvyākhyane caturtha adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ
translated: In the Anubhasya of the venerable Brahmasutra composed by the illustrious Acharya Anandatirtha, the third chapter of the fourth section.

analyzed: atikrama uktiḥ kṛtiḥ artha lābhaḥ parā gatiḥ pāra gatiḥ tat okaḥ
translated: Transgression, statement, accomplishment, gain of wealth, supreme goal, crossing over, and the abode of that,

analyzed: samasta kāryam vaśitā ca viśva sambhāvanā yuktayaḥ tu anya pakṣe
translated: The totality of action, and mastery - the belief in the universe are the arguments in the other view.

analyzed: sāmānya rūpam pratibhāna muktiḥ āścarya tā a kṛtrima tā asta doṣaḥ
translated: The universal form, eloquence, liberation, wonder, artlessness, and the absence of faults,

analyzed: viśeṣa kḷptiḥ kṛta niḥśramaḥ ca māhātmyam iti eva su nirṇaya arthāḥ
translated: The establishment of distinctions, and being free from exertion, are the greatness, which are well-determined for the sake of understanding.

analyzed: ananya bhṛtya tvam iha udita bhyastu anyasya bhṛtya tva nivāraṇāya
translated: The statement of being the servant of none is made here to prevent being the servant of another.

analyzed: patim yat eṣām api viṣṇum āha hi uta amṛta tvasya patitva vāc hareḥ
translated: Since he says that Vishnu is the lord even of them, and the statement of being the lord of immortality is true.

analyzed: ete viṣṇu anya cit tvena yathā pumāṃsaḥ
translated: And these also are endowed with lordship over others, as men are by having their minds on someone other than Vishnu.

analyzed: prasiddhi bhājaḥ tu iti ca anumā eva hi abhīṣya siddhayai bhavati iha niścayāt
translated: And these are also well-known, and inference alone is for the attainment of the desired conclusion here, due to certainty.

analyzed: mukta svakīya avara yantṛ tā asti muktau api brahma purassarāṇām
translated: There is the state of being the protector of the liberated and the not-yet-liberated even in liberation for those who are led by Brahman.

original: anena devena tathāmunā ca hīṣye parārvāktanalokināmiti // / / //
analyzed: anena devena tathā amunā ca hi iṣye para arvāktana lokinām iti
translated: By this god and by that god, I will attain the world beyond the sky.

analyzed: phalam śrutiḥ jñānataḥ āha muktau etat ca sarva aśubha nāśa liṅgāt
translated: The result is stated by the scripture to be knowledge in liberation, and this is indicated by the mark of the destruction of all evil.

analyzed: loka ādhipatyam ca vidhātuḥ eva sarva ātmanā iti āha turaśrutiḥ ca
translated: And the lordship over the worlds belongs to the creator himself, who is the soul of all, and the scripture also says so.

original: sarve baliṃ devagaṇā vahantītyetacca nānyasya hi yuktimeti // / / //
analyzed: sarve balim deva gaṇāḥ vahanti iti etat ca na anyasya hi yuktim eti
translated: All the hosts of gods carry tribute, and this also makes sense only for none other than him.

original: lokā itīhāpi tu lokināṃ vaco lokā iti hyeva ravaḥ prajāsu /
analyzed: lokāḥ iti iha api tu lokinām vacaḥ lokāḥ iti hi eva ravaḥ prajāsu
translated: And here also the word worlds is the statement of the people of the worlds, for the sound among the people is indeed worlds.

original: prayujyate sarvajanaiḥ sadaiva tanmānino lokapadena coktāḥ /
analyzed: prayujyate sarva janaiḥ sadā eva tad māninaḥ loka padena ca uktāḥ
translated: They are always employed by all people, and are called by the worldly term 'lords'.

original: tadgāstu muktā iha lokaśabdā anyonyanāthā iti paiṅgināṃ śrutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tadgāḥ tu muktāḥ iha loka śabdāḥ anyonya nāthāḥ iti paiṅginām śrutiḥ
translated: The scriptures of the Pingis say that those liberated souls are called 'lokas' (worlds), and are mutually dependent.

original: alokaśabdena vimuktibhājo vācyāḥ padaṃ tādṛgapīha yuktam /
analyzed: aloka śabdena vimukti bhājaḥ vācyāḥ padam tādṛś api iha yuktam
translated: The liberated souls should be denoted by the word 'aloka' (light), and such a term is also appropriate here.

original: lokābhidhāścāpi yato hi muktāḥ prakāśarūpāḥ satataṃ ca sarve /
analyzed: loka abhidhāḥ ca api yatas hi muktāḥ prakāśa rūpāḥ satatam ca sarve
translated: Because all the liberated souls are always of the nature of light, and are also called 'lokas' (worlds).

analyzed: brahmā eva loka adhipatiḥ vimuktaḥ bhavet iti prāha turaśrutiḥ ca
translated: The scripture of the Turis says that only Brahman, being liberated, would be the lord of the worlds.

original: naceha vijñānaphalaṃ samuktaṃ lokādhipatyaṃ ravibimbato harau /
analyzed: na ca iha vijñāna phalam samuktam loka ādhipatyam ravi bimbataḥ harau
translated: Here, the fruit of knowledge is not mentioned as lordship over the worlds or in Hari, the sun-like form.

original: uktaṃ pṛthak tacca puraiva yasmād bhedo 'munetyādi ca samyaguktaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uktam pṛthak tat ca purā eva yasmāt bhedaḥ munā ityādi ca samyak uktaḥ
translated: And that is mentioned separately earlier, therefore the difference is rightly stated as 'this one' etc.

original: tvapratyayaṃ cāpyatihāya naiva rūpeṇa teneti bhavedihārthaḥ /
analyzed: tu apratyayam ca api atihāya na eva rūpeṇa tena iti bhavet iha arthaḥ
translated: And disregarding the pronoun 'tvam' (you), the meaning here would be 'by that form'.

analyzed: bhavati asau iti aṇu śabdam atra vihāya vākyāni bahūni doṣaḥ
translated: Or disregarding the many statements here with the word 'asau' (he), there is a fault.

original: ato jagadvayāpṛtimanta eva brahmādayaḥ pūrṇaguṇāḥ krameṇa /
analyzed: atas jagat vayāpṛtimantaḥ eva brahma ādayaḥ pūrṇa guṇāḥ krameṇa
translated: Therefore, Brahman and others, who are fully endowed with qualities, are indeed engaged in the creation of the world in due order.

analyzed: amandam ānandam ajasram eva bhuñjantaḥ ātmīyam ajāt samāsate
translated: Enjoying the unceasing and intense bliss that belongs to them, they abide from beginningless time.

analyzed: namaḥ namo śeṣa viśeṣa pūrṇa guṇa eka dhāmne puruṣottamāya
translated: Salutations, salutations to the Supreme Person, the abode of all perfect qualities,

analyzed: bhakta anukampāt ati śuddha saṃvid dātre n upādhi priya sat guṇa ātmane
translated: To the giver of pure consciousness out of compassion for devotees, to the one whose nature is the true qualities free from limitations.

original: yasya trīṇyuditāni vedavacane rūpāṇi divyānalaṃ baṭ tad darśatamitthameva nihitaṃ devasya bhargo mahat /
analyzed: yasya trīṇi uditāni veda vacane rūpāṇi divya analam baṭ tat darśatam ittham eva nihitam devasya bhargaḥ mahat
translated: Whose three divine forms are mentioned in the Vedic texts, indeed, that splendor of the god is seen thus alone and well-established.

original: vāyo rāmavaconayaṃ prathamakaṃ pṛkṣo dvitīyaṃ vapurmadhvo yattu tṛtīyametadanumā granthaḥ kṛtaḥ keśave // / / //
analyzed: vāyoḥ rāma vacaḥ nayam prathamakam pṛkṣaḥ dvitīyam vapuḥ madhvaḥ yat tu tṛtīyam etat anumā granthaḥ kṛtaḥ keśave
translated: This first statement of Vayu, the second form of Pṛkṣa, and the third of Madhu, this treatise is composed for Keśava.
Free from all faults, possessing all auspicious good qualities,

analyzed: bhūti svayambhu śarva ādi vandyam tvām naumi me priyam
translated: I praise you, who are to be revered by Bhūti, Svayambhu, Śarva, and others, my beloved.

analyzed: iti śrīmat ānandatīrtha bhagavat pāda ācārya viracite śrīmat brahmasūtra anuvyākhyāne caturthaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter in the Anubhāṣyabhāṣya on the venerable Brahmasūtras composed by the venerable Ānandatīrtha, the illustrious teacher.
